description: YES. So happy to find this place. Stumbled in here in the middle of trivia night, fresh off the 1-way fight moving here from Chicago. Literally dropped our stuff off in the empty new place, and headed out to check out the neighborhood. This was the first bar we came across that was serving food, and it looked cool and unpretentious. Perfect - we were hoping to find a new neighborhood local spot to grab beers occasionally, but did not expect to find it so quickly!! Since then we've been in a number of times and I have to say I'm super impressed by how nice everybody is here. Great service, beer selection and awesome people. Scott the trivia host immediately welcomed us and let us catch up in the game, then chatted with us later. Super cool dude. The bartenders are so nice, remembered our names after the first visit, and always make us feel welcome. Thanks Sienna & Shay :)
author: Hannah M.

description: I tried their mushroom swiss burger for lunch and loved it. I am big fan of their onion rings and basket of curly fries. I have been there a few times. Great ambience and good food. Will definitely visit often as this place is very close to my work place.
author: Devan K.

description:
The beer selection here is ok, not great. The sports on TV selection is ok, not great. The staff is hit or miss depending on whose working. The food is par for a bar.

We frequent this place because we prefer to bring our City Taqueria burritos in and have a beer. For that purpose it's more than adequate. 

If I was just drinking for sporting events in the neighborhood, would go to the athletic club. When with tourists who want a slightly higher style or drink, go to wild hare.
author: David A.

description:
Went in last Thursday sat down and waited for approximately 15 minutes. Made eye contact multiple times with the bartender, yet he still would not serve me. Others who came in after me were, however.

Don't want to play the race card (frankly, I think they're just douchebags who were bullied in high school), but a really odd business-model to say the least. You've lost two of my friends who live in the neighborhood as customers too.
author: Ali A.

description: Great 'dive' bar with a friendly vibe and easy going feel. Bartender Natasha was funny and made fantastic drinks!
author: Rich S.

description: I've lived in the neighborhood for years and always avoid this place. Originally, it was only because it was a little rowdy and that's just not my style. After visiting, it is because the service was poor (bar staff really was only attentive to regulars) and unhelpful (don't ask about Happy Hour specials and what the cocktails are, pretend only beer exists)
author: Lauren A.

description:
I have been coming to this bar for years and have made friends and met the people and have given them lots of service over the years. This relatively new bartender who goes by the fake name Corny (real name Ryan) cut me off after having one cocktail and two beers. He saw me hugging someone and cut me off for no reason. I just left the bar because the manager Shay said I couldn't come back for two weeks because of something I don't fully understand. Lame. Don't come to this bar.

I will be amending my will to not leave this judgmental and awful bar money. I only left them money in my will because I met the love of my life there and used to enjoy the bar. 

If you want to go to a local bar where they don't care at all about the customers, come here!

UPDATED:
The bouncer Jason is on an ego trip almost all of the time. 
The music is awful and mainstream. 
Douchebag central, including the bartender's boyfriends. 
You can get BANNED for not being liked (currently discussing this with lawyers). 
Service is awful. 
Don't let Shay play her shitty music. She has no taste. Also, she plays the same 20 songs. 
There is absolutely nothing special about this bar. 

I hope SFAC puts them out of business. 

They are THE WORST. 

This is a bar where bartenders let you behind the counter against the owner's wishes, the bartenders flirt with locals instead of doing their damn job, and attitude is on high. 

Also, Jaslien gets butt hurt really easily and Ryan (aka Corny) is just a pretentious douchebag. 

F*** this place.
author: Samantha S.

description: With the closure of Lion Pub, I've been spending more time here. Of course, that's not what the patrons here want to hear because this is a pretty local spot. It seems most people know everyone here. It's a small, intimate space and the feng shui is a bit off, but don't be deterred. Some nights there is a great crowd, beer is still cheapish, and they serve food late. My favrorite beer here is the local Pine Street pale. $6. I hope this place stays open for a while, in contrast to other parts of Divis, this section is quite dead and this spot is a welcome, cheerful exception. Thank you for that.
author: Brian J.

description: Just a good neighborhood bar with a good cocktail menu and Big Buck. Good prices too!
author: Kym P.

description:
Bartender was really friendly and happy hour is from 2-7 PM, one of the longer HHs in the city. Ordered a Moscow Mule (apart of the Happy House special) and had good conversation. Place wasn't crowded at 3 PM on a Monday (don't judge). Bartender said it normally starts getting crowded at 5 PM.

Happy to say they do have Fishbowls at Fishbowl. I didn't order one, but thought they need to have one based on their name. Also, they're super friendly with the pizza place next door which will even deliver pizza to you while you're at the Fishbowl. 

On the smaller side, but I would consider it cozy. Would come back.
author: Arezou A.

description: Great neighborhood bar. Has everything you need, small so you don't have to line up for drinks, and the young woman at the bar - don't remember her name but she's always there - is super friendly and flexible. Four screens ensure continuous sports viewing. The food is extremely limited to chicken wings and chicken tenders with curly fries. Ain't a gourmet place but you can't knock it for that, be glad they have ANY food right? I love coming here on Sundays after Church to watch football, eat wings and drink beer - or Jameson neat ;)
author: Massimo M.

description: Came here on a Saturday night to grab a drink after seeing UF lose to FSU.  The place surprisingly was dead but is a decent local dive bar.  The bathroom was very strange, just a urinal in a small room with kegs of beer lol.  No toilet for number 2's.  I heard HH is busier and more lively.
author: Nyla K.

description: Pizza next door, reasonably priced beer and cocktails, a bouncer that keeps the weirdos out and nice bartenders.
author: William K.

description:
Great neighborhood place.  Places like this I dig.  Great barternders.  Full bar. 
Love the fish tank. 
Oh and they may bring you pizza from next door if you stay long enough ;)
author: Alex R.

description: First day in San Francisco and just wanted a bar to have a drink in. Found this place on yelp. Wish I didnt. The bartender had a very generous pour but that was about it. The bar was sticky and in turn made my hands sticky and phone. Wasn't very inviting for a Friday happy hour. The bartender was socializing more with guests leaving when I tried to order. When I brought the empty glasses up to leave and said thank you,  no acknowledgement. This could be a good place for locals, but not for tourists.
author: Katie O.

description:
Fun (but teeny tiny) Lower Pac Heights bar.

My kickball team and I moseyed on over after our *sigh* second loss of the season and enjoyed $3 beers, flat screen TVs showing the Giants (winning against the Padres), and endless games of (cramped a$s) flip cup in the back.

This is a particularly fun time of year to head to Fishbowl because a bunch  of intermurals are going on down the block at Hamilton, so you meet a lot of people and see old friends (if you're local). It gets rowdy, so not recommended if you don't plan to get on that level in my opinion. 

The bartender was nice yesterday, don't know if she's the bartended every week. I suppose I'll find out. You'd think that Fishbowl management would want to schedule at least two bartenders, or a bartender and a cook on Sunday afternoons knowing that there's a ton of people who head there after their games, just a thought.

At any rate, it's a fun dive bar and I'll certainly be back for mas!
author: Crystal C.

description: Love fishbowl! Great local spot and Lacy the bartender is awesome. Not to mention delicious sweet potato tots...can't go wrong!
author: Beth O.

description:
We used to spend Christmas evenings here after coming home from family visits and weekend nights trying to score a boyfriend for my friend. 

Sadly, we have the kid now so we can no longer do our post-holiday ritual and my friend moved away, boyfriendless.

But still, great people, solid drinks, and a chill spot to pop in and watch whatever sport is on.
author: Loli L.

description:
Too divey for this diva. The Fishbowl is the kind of bar I would end up at only to meet friends, and only if I couldn't talk them into leaving and going to Fat Angel around the corner. It's divey in an unintentional, anti-trendy kind of way. I suppose the word for that would simply be: dirty. 

Our friends ordered Coronas. We attempted to order something less gross. I took the plunge and asked for my standard St Germain on the rocks...nervous pause...and the bartenders response was something to the tune of 'what the hell is that?' So I settled on some other sweet girly liquor, which he poured quite happily and cheaply for me. 

Surprisingly, they have food and it looks pretty decent...if you must. Also they have a TV. And free goldfish crackers, though I couldn't find them.
author: Nique F.

description:
Good people, good drink, good prices...good time

nuf' said
author: Aaron B.

description: Great bar for neighborhood locals. The drinks are strong, the female bartender is fun, it doesn't get too crowded at happy hour, and you can order pizza from next door. Bonus points for the digital jukebox in the back! This is my new go-to bar for Lower Pac Heights!
author: Maurice R.

description: This bar is small but really cool and relaxed. Not a fan of the over crowded bars where I can't get a drink. This bar is nothing like that. And when you go, you have to get the Johnny Utah mixed drink.
author: Rich T.

description: Fun, friendly, fresh (kinda) joint with darling bartenders.
author: andrea l.

description: It's an OK bar with semi-decent Manhattan. It's unassuming with an OK service. The only reason why we went here, is because the SF Athletic Pub was packed as it had a game on.
author: Laura S.

description:
Fishbowl is a solid spot for a quick, no frills drink in the Lower Pac Heights area... but that's about it. Friendly bartenders, a cool enough crowd of people to hang amongst, and cheap enough drinks that act as a nice pre or post-game spot when bar hopping around other spots in the 'hood.

If you're a video gamer, you'll dig the Buckshot action in the back -- it's a must every time I'm there!
author: Ruggy J.

description:
Stumbled into Fishbowl around 10:15 on a Saturday night and was really surprised to see that it wasn't too busy, but very grateful that there were open seats.

We ordered a round of drinks and the boy and I shared some chicken tenders and curly fries which cost about $7. Pretty good deal since they give you a huge amount of fries and 3-4 strips! 

Fishbowl is on the smaller side, so come early if you like having a spot to sit at. The bartenders are friendly and make great drinks! It's another nice, little spot on Divis to grab some drinks.
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Can't give a fair review, which is the only reason I'm ranking it kind of low. 
By the time we made it here (12-12:30ish) I was done drinking so I didn't look at prices or take a deep look into their selection.

The place wasn't really busy for a Saturday night which kind of bummed me out and put a damper on my buzz.

However, we did have the jalepeno poppers and I have to say they were probably the best I've ever tasted in my whole life. Seriously. I would come back here to drink just so I can have those again.
author: Courtney S.

description:
When I lived in lower pac heights I had never stepped foot in here cause the outside looked rather unappealing and out of place. I've only been here for going away events, which was as recent as a few months ago.

Standard pub food but I'll say the curly fries, hot wings, and jalapeno poppers were pretty bomb by itself. The beer to wash it down with made it even better.

What I'm most disappointed in is the bartender service - when it gets busy, ordering a drink or some food takes FOREVER (like, 30 minutes standing there while the bartender chick flirts with the regular patrons on the other side of the counter and makes it a point to go down the counter to take orders kind of forever). The chick working last time I went couldn't even remember if I paid or not right after handing over my card cause she was talking to other people. Really?!

I hate waiting unless it's worth it. And for what this place offers, definitely not worth any sort of wait. Thus, I'm only here when someone wants to throw a happy hour/moving on with life type of event.
author: Loriel L.

description:
Stopped in here after the super bowl to drown my 49ers sorrows. Let's just say my sorrows were compounded by the service of the bartender. This had to be the worst bartender I've ever come across. I'm not sure about his name but he had a complete hipster look with a dumb hat on. The place was busy but it wasn't packed to the gills. I stood there for a good 10 minutes before he even acknowledged me. I literally had to wave my hand to get his attention (something I hate doing at bars because I know bartenders hate that). Most of the time he sat down behind the bar to talk to his friends. 

As I flagged him down for my second drink while he was ignoring the entire bar, he got up with a "you're bothering me" attitude and proceeded to  take my order with a scowl. I'm not a bar owner but I think you should at least smile and be friendly to the customers while you're behind the bar. And spending most of your time talking to your girlfriend instead of taking people's orders is not the mark of a good barkeep. I will usually give a place a second chance, but not this one.
author: Michael S.

description:
I love the Fishbowl. The place has a nice vibe, a good range of drinks and friendly bartenders. Its not the biggest bar so there are times when it can get pretty packed especially during game nights. 

But during most nights its a really nice place to hang out in.
author: Graham I.

description:
Monday through Thursday The Fisbowl is all locals. It's the neighborhood spot.  There are great bartenders. Good music. Just a good crowd with warm energy.

Oh and the fishbowl in this place. Yes - the literal fish bowl is just a pool of drama. The little fish is a terror. He spends his existence being a fish bully. Chasing around the other fish. All day. Every day.

Oh and Buckshot - here. Always fun. And on Monday - trivia night is a crowd favorite. Though get ready for some heated competition. 

On the weekend - a whole new crowd descends on The Fishbowl. Not really my scene. And the bathroom - which on a normal weekday has seen better days - gets that much more grungier. But that's a problem for most bars  - come the weekend.

My advice - come during the week - early on - and enjoy kicking back with a nice mixture of solid people.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
The only times I had ever patroned the Fish Bowl was after a long (and usually buzzed) night of work at Mexican down the street. So coming in sober and before midnight changed my perception a bit.

Bartenders and owner were friendly and poured reasonably priced stiff drinks. Bullet and a Bud for $11 works for me....

The best part was when I asked the bartender- Brendan- if they had anymore dice (we were trying to play a game of Midnight with only 5 dice!) and he happily went next door, bought these amazing clear dice, and proceeded to turn our time into an eventful game night! 
Now that's good management!
author: Rachel G.

description:
PAC-12 TV contract got you down?  Finally a bar dedicated to actual PAC-12 teams!!!!!  They even ordered Comcast JUST to make the masses happy! 

The marina is infected with Penn State, Ohio State, Nebraska and Florida Fans.  It's about time we have a bar where local kids can support their teams! There's even a PAC-12 flag in the bar with enough TV's to cover good games!  Food, good beers, awesome staff.  What more could you want?

(CAL, Stanford, USC, UCLA, Arizona, Arizona State, Washington, Washington State, Oregon, Oregon State, Colorado, Utah)
author: Jean B.

description:
LOVE this place. Great cocktails (though a tad pricey).  Good beer selection. The place is well maintained without looking like an "airport bar".  

Friendly people and just a cool place to hangout. (I can easily overlook the "marina"-ish crowd , because there are plenty of others who don't resort to high-5'ing everyone.

Best of all ... ERIK. He is a really hot whiteboy with a nice skanky beard and a tight little body, and his furry legs =)

Enjoy this place, i do when I get the chance!
author: Sara D.

description:
Somehow I tend to end up here as my last bar of the night when I go out in my 'hood.  I also seem to give a lot of guys my phone number here...perhaps there's a correlation between the two...

Reasonably priced drinks, deliciously crispy curly fries, and the Big Buck Hunter video game.  Good times.

The bathroom is fairly disgusting, but once again, I'm generally buzzed enough to no longer care.
author: Allison D.

description: I am digging this little dive bar with the super chill Czech bartender that was chatting us up about his life story, and left us alone when we obvi needed alone time. We just had a couple beers, but they have a legit menu. They seem to cater to a pretty European-friendly crowd. Sports up on the screen, we watched the Bruins lose the Stanley Cup :(
author: Vivian H.

description:
This place used to be a legit San Francisco sports bar, but today the Giants/Dodgers game (the only Bay Area game right now) is on the smallest television? September baseball, against our biggest rival, in a race for the division.. it matters y'all. I can't even tell which team is up to bat, it's so hard to see. No wonder everybody is moving on to the SFAC. I'm closing out right now and moving on as well. 

Pros: good beer selection and good memories.
Cons: abandoning your city's pastimes.
author: Matt B.

description: My cousin An-Nhien L. and her friends threw an awesome private event here on NYE! The bartenders were super cool and friendly and one even remembered me the next day when I came in to pick up my credit card that I forgot to close out the night before (hot mess!). I'd definitely come back here for the strong drinks, bar food, and kind hospitality. Thank you Fishbowl for helping me ring in the new year right!
author: Mymy N.

description:
For my 100th review, I chose the Fishbowl as it was one of the many stops I made on my birthday weekend that just passed. Hurray! 

My boyfriend and I stumbled upon this joint while waiting for Tortilla Heights to open up just a block away. There was a sign out front advertising a happy hour with $3 cocktails and draughts and $5 moscow mules. That immediately caught my eye and I was delighted to hear they honored happy hour even on Saturday! 

Immediately upon sitting at the bartop, our eyes caught glimpse of an actually fishbowl (really a fishtank) that had a Giants stadium background, a baseball sitting at the bottom and two happy angel fish swimming around. There were TVs with the preseason game on and SF Giants accoutrements garnishing the walls of the room.

We ordered Pacifico on tap and of course took advantage of the $5 moscow mules. We had a lot of time to kill so we asked for dice and were offered a wide array of games they had like Jenga and Apples to Apples by the friendly and helpful bartkeep Sharbel, I believe his name was (Sorry, but I did ask you to spell it for me upon our departure- hope I heard you correctly :). There was a pair of old arcade style hunting games in the corner near the loo as well. 

According to the literature posted around the bar, there is a trivia night I believe on Mondays and judging from the large PAC12 flag hanging above the front door, you can probably catch these games on their big screens. 

With that said, I'm happy to report that stopping at the Fishbowl on my birthday was a great way to kill a couple of hours. Cheap and delicious drinks, games, friendly and attentive bartender. 4 stars. 5, if I have an equally nice experience next time.
author: Christina S.

description:
My friend lives right around the corner for The Fishbowl, so everytime I visit, we walk over for drinks.

I love this place, although it is small and the bathroom is kind of scary.  They have a good beer selection and friendly staff.  It can get pretty crowded on weekends.
author: Teri W.

description:
There is seriously a shortage of Big Buck Hunter video game machines in SF. And when you find one, half of the time the guns aren't functioning properly. 

So when I find a functional Big Buck Hunter Pro (Open Season) machine that's well maintained, I keep notice.  The Fishbowl has the best Buck Hunter Pro machine within a 1 mile radius, and probably more.

Also, there's a generous happy hour ($3 drafts till 7pm), friendly staff (the bartender actually came up to me 10 minutes after I ordered and gave me money back because he realized he had overcharged me), and tasty bar food (the other night they guy working in the kitchen gave me a free little shotglass of fresh dungeness crab after we struck up a conversation.  They're great!
author: John H.

description:
love love love love love it! I so wish I'd gotten the bartenders name that was there on Sunday. She was awesome, and totally hot too. The place was packed with kickball and sunday recess people and she didn't even blink and eyelash, jsut giggled a little and kept pouring out the shots. I had an absolute blast here. Things I need in a Bar,
PBR check
Jameson check
friendly bartender check
cozy atmosphere check
food check
tv check

Yeah its a smaller place adn teh group we were with took it over but it was awesome. Friend of mine ordered a turkey metl and fries which I munched on and it was perfect drunk food. Def had an interesting Sunday evening after all of our shots but I am def looking foward to going back to this place.
author: Meg N.

description:
The Fishbowl is A-OK.

There's nothing really all that special about this place.  I've never tried the food, but it's a solid place to grab a drink, which are reasonably priced (both beer and liquor).  More often than not when I show up here I'm already a little buzzed.  In fact the last time I was here I was sober and commented how different it looked.

The place itself is kind of small, and it's probably not the type of bar you'd plan to spend all night at, but it's a good way to start or end an evening with a couple drinks.  They do have a few TV's, which is nice if you wanna catch a game.  

I really can't think of anything that really stands out about this place that's really worth commenting on.  Oh yeah, the bathroom is gross.
author: George A.

description:
Even before I found a place to sit the bartender greeted me immediately and asked if I wanted a drink. It's 6:30 and I'm thirsty, so how about a YES! Now this is a dive bar but I thought I would put the bartender to a test and asked him if he could make a caipirinha.

He did a quick scan of the bar and found a bottle of cachaca and got straight to work. Within minuntes I not only had a freshly prepared caipirinha I had a PERFECTLY awesome caipirinha! 

The bar is nicely laid out and obviously can handle most of your complicated drink orders. They also offer a nice selection of greasy bar food bites which can be a Godsend when you decide that you may have one or three too many.

There is also a nice flat panel HD television which is visible from most of the seating. On this night they had the Colts and Dolphins, but instead of watching the game I sat down with two Yelp megastars. Both recently awarded ROTD's even. 

There is music, but it at a perfect volume which made it easy to have a good conversation without having to scream. The bartender checked on us often and made sure we did not die of thirst.

The perfect place to spend a Monday night.
author: Rene C.

description: Service is great!! There are many friendly locals and regulars. It's a great place to relax, dance (if you feel inclined), watch NatGeo, Discovery Ch., or sports (if you're into that), but more importantly, it's a great place to drink! Totally recommend this place to anyone who is looking for great conversation with good people.
author: Nicole G.

description:
Oh fishbowl. What is there not to like about you. Between my favorite fishies Panda and Posey to my favorite babe bartenders Holly Christine and Erika to SundayFunday Football BBQs. Your cheap drinks and perfectly crispy curly fries served with ranch and buffalo wing sauce (if I ask nicely) are the reason I wake up everyday. You run across my mind almost everyday midweek around 1230pm when I just can't bare the thought of another 5 hours of work. You are where I meet my best friends every week to grab a drink, laugh and kick some ass at liars dice. You are where I meet new friends. And when friends come from out of town, you are where I suggest to start the  first to  night... and/or end up at. Your door man is the best and does his job. Your new bar manager is pretty cool. Your owners are awesome and are always lovely to share a drink with. I love your diversity. I love the new, the old, the bad and the ugly that walks thru your door.  I even love old man Jim and  Cowboy Jonny that is here every night with a flash light reading a book.  I love the fact you don't tolerate douche bags (male or female). 

You are my Cheers. And I am happy to anyone and everyone that knows your name. 

Pros: everything 

Cons: people that come to fishbowl and can't recognize a good thing
author: Katie S.

description:
Living near here, I've developed a negative impression of the place due to their patronage frequently spilling onto Divis as I walk home from work trying to think of what to make for dinner. But, ending up here one night not too long ago I really appreciated having this bar in the neighborhood. Yes, they have TVs with sports playing all the time. Yes, people do come here to get drunk and then hit on passersby as they smoke in front of it. But, the bartenders were nice, the prices were fair, and they have a food menu that they don't cut off too early. When you're tipsy (okay, more than tipsy) those curly fries are AMAZING, our group concluded as we ordered one, then a second, then a third and fourth basket.

Solid place. I think they also have pub quiz trivia night on Mondays, I may have to check it out (though, it's pretty tiny, not sure how many people will fit).
author: Ashley L.

description:
Funny, the review written in 2007 by "Lauren F" still rings true today (in 2013) .. there are FAR too many "collar poppin douchebags"

I don't recall the last time I was surrounded by so many starched, button-down, collared shirts with vertical stripes.  OH, wait!  .yes, I do ..it was in the 1980's

I cannot believe that 20-something guys still press their shirts until creases down the sleeves are perfect, then rolled up to the forearm. Wow, only on HGTV and The Food Network do I see guys like this... complete with perfect, manicured hair. 

Aside from this annoying "fashion" faux pas, along with the accompanying fratboy posturing and beer guzzling ..the place is "OK".

The female bartender was very nice, made great drinks, and there were plenty of smiles and fairly friendly people who were there to do their usual Friday happy hour thing.

If you want a place to hang out for an hour or two, with good drinks at fair prices, maybe have some greasy finger food, go for it.  But I wouldn't make a special trip to this place, nor would I bring out-of-town visitors ..unless they liked the smell of laundry starch.
author: Ted K.

description:
my neighbor hood bar. the drinks are priced right and most nights it's fun. 
but hell Johnny and his flashlight...
author: florian s.

description:
Solid dive-ish bar on Divis. Clearly attracts a different crowd than Solstice or Lion Pub just down the street. Trivia on Mondays I think. Chicken tenders w/ curly fries are good. Drinks are cheap, bartenders are friendly, and their menu board on the street is usually quite witty ("Soup of the day: Whiskey"). Not exactly spacious so it gets crowded pretty quickly in the evenings. 

Not my first choice of bars in the area, but I'm never unhappy when I go there.
author: Farhad M.

description:
One round of Kamikaze shots for four dollars on Fridays may sound vaguely suicidal to some people. But for the V girls, it's just business as usual. Any bar with a sweet drink special on the day of the week that shares its name with our surname is destined to be a friend of the family.

We are also big fans of the benevolent entity who put extra money in the jukebox and allowed us to get all "The Chronic" out of our systems for free. Did you know I am straight-up gangsta so long as Snoop Dog is on the speakers? Well, I am. I will stalk you for your table at this aptly-monikered bar, and if you don't give it up, there will be a heeled boot all over your backside. That's how the V girls roll, in my mind. Kamikaze shots encourage that hellified gangsta lean.
author: Kimberly V.

description:
Best little hangout on Diviz, with the best chicken strips and curly fries omgah...  lol

Beware tho, if you get there too late they usually run out of chicken and curly fries!  :'(  So don't be too surprised if they are!
author: Jammir G.

description:
With all the bar options in the city, there is really no reason to go here.  It's not like I have high standards.  I just go to bars to drink with friends; where that happens normally doesn't really matter.  But that wasn't the case here.  
We came on a Thursday night.  Place was pretty quiet.  Still, I guess the bartenders had something important to discuss, because they really seemed bothered by us ordering drinks.  Seems like one of those bro-tastic places for bros.
author: Eric F.

description:
This place is kind of small. But with a name like The Fishbowl, what do you expect?

Also in accordance with its name, Fishbowl became yesterday's dive of choice in which to imbibe to the likes of one of its scaly, swimmy inhabitants. I had lost my uninsured Blackberry Pearl the day before, so let's just say I was pretty freakin' determined to drink until my downgrade of a replacement phone looked A-OK. 2 Stellas, 2 Kamikaze shots, and 2 pear ciders later, I could no longer figure out the buttons on my new uber-user friendly Nokia to text my friend the name of a wine bar I thought she'd like to try. Job well done, Fishbowl, job well done!

This place has some sweet drink specials, including my favorite 4 Kamikazes for $10 on Friday nights. Add to that the awesome "Divisadero Ale House" sign above the entrance (NOPA 4 Life, baby!) and the fact that they accept credit cards, and we have ourselves an almost clear winner. However, no one likes being in a fishbowl for too long, especially when it gets overly crowded and your fellow fishies start getting all up in your space and you wanna swim away but you bump into another fishy and he spills his beer all over you.

But good for drinking like a fish? YES!
author: Kate V.

description: Went here in the afternoon after getting off a flight from NYC - had a few beers and chatted with the friendly bartender about the area. Cool little hole-in-the wall place with a nice vibe and TVs with sports on
author: Phil M.

description:
Quality neighborhood bar with nice drink selection - that it's a solid pre or post game spot in the neighborhood as others have stated. Neighborhood Bar with smaller crowds on the weekdays but packs in on the weekends.

Food selection is your typical bar or ballpark food - fried but tasty. As the other posters have mentioned - the bathroom is quite weird.

Always nice to have a bar with a solid Buckhunter machine.
author: Brian D.

description:
Divisadero dies at night there when hospitals close

the same owner owns the bar a few doors down,i never really liked it slow service not enough seats even if its empty poor bartending high prices
author: cc c.

description:
You know, I can't find too many bad things to say about this place. A part of me didn't want to like the Fishbowl but by the end of the night, I was a happy camper. 

I don't know if it was because this was the last stop on our Easter Break bar crawl (we were all pretty tossed by then) or maybe because my friend Mary was ready to dance to anything and watching her get loose is always a pleasure.

Maybe it had to do with having fun while playing Connect Four in my drunken state or the pretty bartender who was very accomodating whenever I bought a round.

But I'm guessing it had to do more with the fact that we went out on a Thursday and the chode factor was a non-factor. Not too many single cuties around but hey, that happens sometimes.

I'd normally give this place 3 stars but they get an extra star for the access to Connect Four.
author: Art O.

description:
I am not sure what's hotter, the staff or those damn chicken tenders covered in hot sauce. 

That new bar manager is odd tho, I think I saw him at lions den once riding the lion.... I guess he can party too. 

#1 hook up bar in sf. Say no more
author: David H.

description:
Wow, didn't realize this place was a restaurant too.  I can't imagine eating food here.  I'll admit, most bars have seen better times then on a busy Friday night. But this place was just rank.  

The crapper smelled like, well, crap.  And I could not get the odor out of my head...especially since it made its way up to the bar.  

The Fishbowl aspires to reach dive status, but honestly, its just more dump.
author: Susan L.

description: Holly gave me great service. She was funny and timely. My cocktails were in my hand and I was able to get back to laughing with my friends without a hassle.
author: Jesse S.

description: Love the Monday night trivia with local host Scott Armstrong. A fun, conveniently located little bar in a very nice area, without the "bros and bimbos" crowd that the Wild Hare seems to attract up the street. Tasty snacks at an affordable price are a huge plus (I recommend the Sweet Po-Tater Tots, only $4 a basket). If you've got some time to kill in the Lower Pacific Heights area and don't want to break the bank, I suggest visiting the Fishbowl for a pint or two. There are also great food options in the immediate vicinity; Presidio Pizzeria two doors up, El Burrito Express 5-6 doors down.
author: Sean R.

description:
Where do i begin...

TV's - check 
Bar Food - check 
Friendly staff - check 
Reasonable prices - check
Big buck hunter - check check check

Sold - to those who are simply looking for a good time
author: Kendra S.

description: Love Fishbowl. Great local bar with reasonable prices. Love the bartender. Also they have big buck hunter and you can typically find a seat.
author: Erin F.

description:
Good place to start the night or end the night.

Pros: Good prices, good crowd and easy to get in and out. Plenty of TVs to watch the game while you're standing around. Plus the free goldfish crackers are a nice bonus.

Cons: Horrible bathroom and gets a little too crowded and noisy due to the small space.

Overall: Great neighborhood bar.
author: Binh D.

description:
A few notes from my most recent Fishbowl experience:

- I love guest bartenders!!! : it was SO fun to be served drinks by my friends Summer and Megan. I hope I can guest bartend sometime!
- the goldfish crackers were not on the bar, where were they? :/
- I figured out what the "grill" is! It's Frankie's burgers next door and I tried their nachos... they were delicious!
- my guy friend accidentally reviewed a women's clothing store in the Mission called the Fishbowl instead of this bar... very funny!!!

I'll be back! (and hopefully behind the bar bartending!)
author: Meghan P.

description: First of all the places smells.  The female bartender moved like she was in slow motion.  When my chicken strips (very bland and boring) came, I had to ask for a place setting.  AND they forgot the fries that comes with them.  The place was totally dead yet the bartender couldn't manage to keep toilet paper in the bathroom.  Not worth it!
author: Dre C.

description: We were the only ones in the bar for the NBA playoffs (in their defense, it was 3pm in the afternoon), but the bartender was a blast and - as you can imagine - service was quite prompt. Their menu is standard bar fare and they were out of what we wanted, but he was quick on drinks. We were fine, but there's not much seating, so if you go on a packed night, you'll likely be standing.
author: Kevin B.

description: Had a private NYE party here with about 75+ of the most attractive humans in San Francisco (My friends and some family tossed in for good measure) They were extremely accommodating and even hooked us up with some NYE swag! Being able to pick our playlist made the night especially nice and the bartenders poured those drinks with extra love! great experience--great bar--cant wait to return!
author: An-Nhien L.

description:
Fishbowl is a fun place to wonder into and grab some drinks. There are definitely some downsides but in general is a pretty fun place. The location was great for me because I lived a few blocks away so I could walk home easily, which probably lead to me having more good nights there than most ;). 

Beware, this is a tiny bar! if you don't like being a little cramped I would stay away. But simultaneously it adds alot of excitement to the bar because it is so small and intimate that you are often forced to interact with people around you rather than just hanging with your group of friends at a table somewhere. 

Food is ok, nothing special. Great place to go watch sporting events though.

Keep an eye out for the owner (forget his name, but he is the guy in his mid 30's with long blond curly hair and very surfer looking) he gets rowdy, in a good way. Almost everytime I am down there, he is there getting smashed and buying people drinks, hes a lot of fun to party with and adds a lot to the bar.
author: Sam K.

description:
Eh. Went here last night expecting it to be a dive bar by the descriptions on said website. This is NOT a dive bar, this is a small bar! They had nicely painted walls with flat screen TVs playing sports! eh. The bartender was not the brightest. My boyfriend orders my drink and his. My friend doesn't know my drink has been ordered and REorders it along with her drink. She pays for both. 

We awkwardly sit and try to gulp these drinks because this was biddy and douche central. Couldn't wait to leave this bar. Boyfriend asks for the tab and he says $8. (and at this point it was for a PBR) Then the bartender realizes my friend had double ordered my drink and magically the bartender had freakin saved it the whole time and brings it over! WHO DOES THAT?!
He was just letting the ice melt under the bar?? That's weird, he should have just taken the drink off the tab and let us on our merry way!

Never stepping foot in here again!!!

PS Music was mainstream and not so great!
author: Susanna B.

description:
2.5 Stars

$9 for a can of PBR and a shot of whiskey
$7 for chicken tenders and tater tots

Decent music from someones IPOD and person left and it was on to the digital JukeboxfortheloveofGODPLEASEdon'tplaythriller.

I happened to be chatting next to a guy who ordered a bucket of Budweiser ($15), a glass of water, and a cosmo.  The bartender thought he was ordering the cosmo for me so she completely ignored me and went down to the other side and it was a good 5 minutes before she realized I wanted my order:  a manly shot of jack and a PBR.

the crowd was decent... a bunch of dudes.  yay for me.  but i only went for my friends.

Pharell's 'That Girl'
author: Walerz B.

description:
There is a strict series of guidelines a bar must follow  in order for it to get my thumbs up. 

 - bartenders who have an excellent memory an know your drink? (Check)

 - bartenders ability to weed out the douchebags and prissy bitches (see the 1 star ratings) right of the bat and make sure the good people of this world are served their alcoholic beverages?  (Check)

 - bouncer that is good for conversation and imposing enough to keep order?  (Check)

 - decent prices on drinks and shots?  (Check)

 - a menu that encompasses pretty much anything that can be fried? (Check)

 - dice games on demand?  (Check)

 - a stocked music box that plays good music not just what's on the recent "Now 127" CD?  (Check)

All in all it's an excellent place and has achieved the highest praise as my watering hole.  Start your night with fishbowl or just finish it there, you'll come out a winner.
author: Chris B.

description: This is my favorite little dive so far in the city. People mingle, bartenders are a blast, and drinks are cheap.
author: Frankie S.

description:
Was in town back in 2006.  Wanted to try something different so we went to the Fishbowl.  It was probably a Monday night and no one was around but we still had a lot of fun. 

Lots of beers and good prices.  Bartender was cool and conversated with us out-of-towners all night.  Plus there was like $9 free in the jukebox so we had music going too. 

I'd go back.  It's small and has a good atmosphere.
author: Adam K.

description: It is not the Fishbowl it is the CestPool A grotesque, dirty Bar.
author: vahid r.

description:
Whoa....I'm so behind on my Yelp...it's due to my hectic work and travels or it's maybe because I'm upset that I kept getting email from yelp deleting my pictures. What's up with this regulations, it wasn't there before.

Anyho, back to Fishbowl...this place has become Mr & I hang out spot on Sunday. Luv Michelle, she serves a mean Bloody Mary. Staff are great, friendly.

There are 5 TV's that covers all the game (Go Saints, Chargers & Colts!) Bar food is okay, long wait sometimes....

I'm just a bit paranoid, hopefully I don't see some of my staff slacking since it's only a block from KP.
author: jubi l.

description:
Hey douchebags.

When you leave the Fishbowl at 1AM on a Tuesday, could you freaking keep it down?  I'm trying to sleep, and I really don't give two craps about you or your douchy life.  Seriously.  SHUT UP.
author: Akemi Y.

description:
This is a great local watering hole....until the Marina spillover comes on through on a Saturday night and well then hell, it becomes Union Street all over hahaha....

The beers are plenty and the usual bar fare, and the space is nice and cozy(read=SMALL) but overall it is a great place to grab a quick beer and some pretzels during the week with your roommates, friends and guests.

It is cheap, low key, and fun to people watch.
author: Kathy K.

description: The beer is good the fries leave a lot to be desired and so does the service I also wish there was more seating. I went with a group and was waiting for a beer for a while, all while standing as tables were reserved at a bar?!  When a second bartender came on duty it went faster and he was much better at customer service.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
I am not for this place, and this place is not for me. 

It's a bit too dive-y for the area, and apparently I'm not hipster enough. 

After 90 seconds of awkwardness, it was time to leave and head up the hill.
author: Misha F.

description:
Just your average neighborhood Dive Bar.  I started the night off here with classmates during our Pub Golf event.  Prices were reasonable, seating is limited, but they have a cool deer hunter game I enjoyed watching someone try to play for 5 minutes.
I ordered a vodka-tonic and it was decently strong, but I've had better experiences elsewhere for sure.
author: Mark H.

description: This is a great pre-/post-party bar to grab cheap drinks with friendly bartenders.  On game days, it's just too crowded (the bar is really small).
author: Amanda C.

description:
Went here after a performance at DanceGround Keriac across the street, just expecting a normal neighborhood bar, which is exactly what we got.  Even on a Saturday around 11 pm, we were able to snag a table and get served quickly, which was nice.  Draft beers were fresh and cold.  

I unfortunately had a beer spilled down my table and into my lap, but the staff immediately came to my rescue, which was much appreciated.  My partner appreciated the immediate refill too, which was brought over with a flourish by the friendly bouncer.  

It's a bit far from work/home for me to venture out to these parts on a regular basis, but if I were in the area again, I'd try and check out their happy hours and drink specials I saw that they had posted on the wall.
author: Jaimie M.

description: I'm partial to this neighborhood joint because my girlfriend was a bartender here when I started dating her. Bias aside, this is a quality dive bar with good prices, tater tots and Buck Hunter. The central location is a plus for me, but It's also a great spot to watch local sports and is a worthy venue for a fun night out.
author: Adam S.

description: Good for a drink. Didnt get any food, tho. Got TVs and buck hunter!
author: Andrew P.

description:
Free tater-tots with two dipping sauces...need I say more? 

But really, this place is laid back, the bartenders are friendly and generous...many have a heavy hand, and I like it ;)
author: Lindsay U.

description:
BOTTOMLESS MIMOSAS!

Need I say more? I was actually surprised when I showed up and the place was nearly empty for bottomless mimosa day... Total blast. $15 for endless champagne and orange juice. I also tried some of their bar food -- the jalapeno poppers were a perfect fix for my hungry tummy!
author: Lauren F.

description: I like this place. On Divis, right off California Street (used to live over here! Loved it), local neighborhood spot. Solid. Apparently this place has also been a sponsor of a friend of mine's soccer team, which is super cool. They came here all the time, which is actually what brought my attention to this spot! Thumbs up. The bathroom, however, is odd... with the mirrors and such outside. Uneven flooring, too... I stumbled.
author: Kristin F.

description:
Sunday Football Spot  (The have the NFL Pkg)
Michelle (Redskins Firecracker) Great Bartender, funny as hell.
Not too crowded.
Good bar food.
Good People.

My spot for Fernet & Football in the morning...
author: Eric L.

description: Really chill place for drinks and bar food. Great staff, good music and sports!
author: Alex V.

description: The fishbowl is my neighborhood bar and is exactly what it should be.  Really nice people and good bar food.  They have buckets of beer and make the drinks strong.  I don't understand some of the negative reviews.  Did people think they were coming to Bourbon and Branch?  It's a hole in the wall but definitely recommend it.  They serve Abita beer and being from Louisiana it's good to get a taste of the beer we drink back home.  If anyone hasn't tried it I would definitely recommend the Amber and a shot of whiskey...and some chicken wings.  America.
author: Lee S.

description:
Oh Fishbowl, let me count the ways.....

1.  Your bartenders are friendly and always hook up free fruity shot concoctions.
2.  I want your secret closet full of booze.
3.  I love your bouncer and he loves me.  He bought me lots of whiskey shots cause he likes my shit talking skills.  Bouncer, in the future, me and whiskey are like water and oil.  Don't mix.  But thanks for the love.  I will profess my love to you again next time and shower you with hugs.
4.  People show up here in costumes all the time.  Thank you for letting me steal your blonde wig weirdo.
5.  Girls are frisky in this bar.  Like the one who kissed me.  Then I got frisky and slapped her a couple times.
6.  Dudes wear board shorts and flip flops to this bar in January.  I had to make fun of him.  Hey, this ain't SD, mmmmmkay.....

I have decided to take a break from you Fishbowl.  You make me feel pain the next day.  

Thinking to myself:  Come on and check yo self before you wreck yo self

Saying to Fishbowl:  Cause bitches like you is bad for my health.
author: Christina S.

description:
This place has clearly cross-pollinated with Harrys. Guys use the word "bro" in here with regularity. 

Some stranger had a conversation with the door guy and myself about being cock blocked from the most boring gal that the door guy, self admittedly, has ever spoken to. We, mostly for amusement, talked his drunk ass down so he could maintain that large ego of his for yet another day. I got some sort of "right on" mumble-speech and 5 part high five handshake thing for making him feel better. 

They serve alcohol so one extra star for that, and one bonus star for a door guy who seemed to know exactly what he had signed up for and, besides being hot, had a great sense of humor about it.
author: Drue C.

description:
Bitchy bartenders (shame on you for being mean to my friend!) and the men who love them are the norm here, unfortunately. I've been dating a lot of immature douchebags lately, so I'm trying to avoid places like this that magnetically attract men of that particular variety. 
I've been Fishbowling for years and whatever...I live in the neighborhood so it's convenient on nights when Solstice is too packed or I'm inebriated enough to ignore the crowd and the ladies behind the bar. The drinks are unremarkable but I've never actually paid for a drink here, so in that respect the testosterone-heavy crowd hasn't let me down. I'll be back but it won't be for a while.
author: Autumn K.

description:
I wouldn't recommend this place as a regular bar, unless you're on that street and you're in desperate need of getting your drink on.

+1 Star because one of the current bartenders is absolutely adorable in a tattooed punk rock way and they serve goldfish as snack food.

I should have worn my Ohio State cap.  I would have felt more at home here with the other guys who still haven't gotten over their college days.
author: Christopher K.

description:
With the exception of the few days where my friends guest bartended, and I left there totally hammered having given no money to the bar, and all of my money to the bartenders, I loathe this bar.
The marina runneth over to this place on the edge of the western addition and pac heights.  CPD's (collar poppin' douche's) with their bad come on lines, all cram into the bar trying to find the one hot girl they can take home that night.
Its small, cramped, and has the potential to be a great dive bar, but the crowd and energy that come with it are anything but divey.
Redeeming quality- goldfish crackers on the bar, and corndogs and mozzarella sticks in the back.
author: Lauren F.

description:
I had been wondering what this place was about - I live a few blocks away and have passed the fish bowl many many times, looking at the people in and outside who seemed to be enjoying themselves ALOT.  

I came in on a tuesday night, and everyone was happy and drunk - kinda how I like it.  I met the owner, a brick of a man, and was really impressed with how nice he was.  He let me know that its mainly a bar, but they have food.

The bartenders were super nice (and heavy-handed), i enjoyed the drinks and I ended up having quite alot of fun.  I did indeed get way too drunk, but sometimes that's a good thing.  I'm totally coming back.
author: Karen K.

description:
If i was a splotchy faced 23 year old male this is where I would go to do belly rubs with other 23 year old males while talking about surfing and drinking Pabst blue ribbon.  or i would just just talk one of the many "oh my god" girls and get laid.

but....since i am a grown (:() woman,,,*sigh* i just felt like a cougar
(a cougar that got an ass grab and some free drinks ..no less) yyyyyeeeeeeeoooooooowwwwwwwww

i probably won't come back
author: Jenny M.

description:
So my friend calls me at work on Monday and she's frustrated and wants to go get drinks somewhere - preferably martinis. She lives in the Inner Richmond, I live in Presidio Heights, we don't want to go to our usual bar because we don't want to run into everyone we know. She remembers that she wants to watch Heroes, so we have to go somewhere nearby so that she can be home by 9. And we want to take the bus somewhere. So I call her when I get home.

Me: "How about one of those new bars in the Presidio?"
Her: "Nah, too much effort switching buses."
Me: "G Bar? It's a Monday night, it should be empty, and we certainly won't see anyone we know there."
Her: "Ok, meet me on the bus."
I call G Bar on the way to the bus, only to discover that they're closed on Mondays, so I tell her when I get on the bus.

Me: "We can go to the bar in the JCC - at that restaurant 415. I've never been there before though. Or we can go to Solstice. Or Lion's Bar. Or we can go to Harry's Bar."
Her: (As the bus pulls up to the JCC and 415) "Let's just try here" (We walk in) "Wow, this is a little bit older of a crowd than I wanted. And it's too crowded. Let's just go to Solstice."
Me: (As we're getting off the bus at Solstice) "You know, we could just go down to The Fishbowl. I bet it's not crowded."
Her: "The Fishbowl? What's that?"

So the place isn't crowded, but the people who were there were really nice. And good looking. The bartender made us some delicious martinis - fucking HUGE delicious martinis. The music was good (until somebody played Lynyrd Skynyrd, but, shit happens). A great place to have a couple of martinis with your friend and talk about what's annoying you in life at the moment. 

My friend: "Hey, I really like this place. It's cool."
Me: "Yeah, I haven't been here in a while, but I always have liked it during the week when it's not crowded. I came a couple of times on the weekend and wasn't so thrilled - way too crowded."
Her: "Oh please, like either one of us even goes out on the weekend anymore. Unless it's to our usual spot."

Do you want to go there on a Saturday night at 11 pm? Not if you're me. But it's great at 7 pm on a Monday (which is when the "real" drinkers drink anyway).
author: Suge K.

description: It is Saturday night around 1 am. I approach and find 75 guys packed into a divey bar. I turn around and walk out.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
This is where frat boys and sorority girls come to preen thier ever fading feathers to each other.  They do the drunk dance and the shouts of macho self-adulation rings loud. 

High pitched skanky drunk girls.  Oafy dumb and awkward guys.   All in a bar the size of two parking spots.  Weak cocktails and the only redeeming factor is that their beer is cold. 

Woo hoo!!! Gotta come here more often!! (Insert sarcastic tone here)
author: Jay H.

description:
Why is it called a "Bar and Grill" when all they serve is crackers? And that's all you'll find in this shithole. Drunk ass crackers. See review for Stupid Drunk Boys for a better idea on the clientele.
Very Coyote Ugly as the bartender bimbos will hop up on the bar and pour Jaeger into the gaping holes of morons. Chicks are very eager to fuck here, anytime my friend wants to pick up some new tail he goes here so he can score, it takes like seconds. They come right up to you and beg for it! Interesting place to do a study on the young, urban whore.
Oh, and the music is consistantly BAD.
author: Colleen B.

description:
Wow this place gets pretty busy even on a weekday!

A whole bunch of people from work came here to celebrate one of our ASM's 21st birthday. I like how the bar has a very friendly atmosphere. 

I seriously don't know what happened but I got two shots of top shelf liquor and a glass of beer on tap for only $12??

I like this place but it's missing one star because they don't have Hennessey and Heineken!!
author: Nance W.

description:
Hey, I had a blast here yesterday (Sat) afternoon.  After hitting Gino & Carlo and then the Saloon in North Beach, the GF and I hit the Fishbowl.  Izzy the bartender f'ing rocked and then even Frankie came up to introduce himself.  The drinks were strong and the good times flowed.  She even got some food from Frankie's next door and the garlic fries came in a big bowl and were fantastic!  Was hoping to hit another neighborhood bar closer to home after this one, but somehow just never made it.

What a toilet, I f'ing loved it.  Five stars... I WILL be back again. :)
author: Roy N.

description:
Listen, say what you will. If you ambled into the fishbowl looking to meet fine people, you done wrong. If you stumbled into the fishbowl on a Saturday, looking get completely tanked at bargain prices, congrats. Order one "fishbowl" to every 2-3 people, and the let the game begin (and the night abruptly, and drunkenly, end after).

Yes it's a pseudo-pretentious self-aware divebar. Yes there are all sorts of skeezeballs and 17 year olds and trashy sluts. Yes the signature cocktail is roughly equivalent to an acid trip rolled up with a long-island and some blue curacao...but you knew all that when you got there. Stop acting all offended and enjoy your cheap booze. If you want to go frat-bashing, MatrixFillmore is open.
author: Sophie S.

description:
Chillin at the bars with a couple of homies from uptown, we decide to mosey on down to the Fish Bowel for the tail end of the night.  Since it's pretty much across the street from my place, I go with the flow.  We get inside to see a crowd of patrons at the tables, but relatively empty at the bar.  Pulling up some stools, we see two (that's 2, II, TWO) bartenders without a thing to do in the world.  Counting the flies in the place, I'd say.  I wave over to them so we could order.  They both look at us, then turn back around to each other, hands on hips.

Hmmm.... Is my deoderant wearing off?  No...
Do I got a boog hanging?  *sniff* Nope...
Is my appearance like that of a hobo from the train yard?  Not a bit.

Service is something they know nothing about.  Yeah, one of them is pretty hot, but if I paid to have a rack like that, I'd be just as hot.  And to top it off, instead of coming over to help, she walks outside to take a drag.  Bust.

The place is a mere 50 yards away from my front door.  But I can't say I'll be there again any time soon.
author: Zo L.

description:
Okay, okay...I haven't even set foot in this place!  Perhaps if the people hanging out outside weren't  frat boys looking to gang bang someone, I might actually go in and see what its all about.  
Is that fair?  Probably not, but I don't care.  You need to know, it is for your own good.
author: Suzanne L.

description: A small, but fun place to watch a sports game and have a drink. Few tables, and many more seats at the bar. I enjoy coming here for a drink or 2. I tried some of the food (I believe the chicken tender basket with curly fries). It was as delicious as fried food can be. It's nice to have something to snack on while watching the game, that's for sure.
author: Ashley D.

description:
I've been living two blocks from this place for 6 months...no idea they had food, and no way on earth would I want to try it.

Great bar if you wanna get hammered on their shot specials...but the place is always overcrowded (at least if it's worth going to) due to it's severe lack of real estate.
author: I AM SOFA KING WE TODD DI D.

description: Depending On The Bartenders You Get?! This Place Can Be Cool! The Sunday Crew Is  A Bunch OF SIssies! If You Are Native San Franciscan Not You Spot To Let Loose And Watch The Teams. I Use To Like This Place And Frequent It Much, But They Got Shitty With Me And My HomeBoy, One Time Too Many! And Your Boy Don't Play !
author: Miguelito C.

description:
Oh Fishbowl, you are so good to me.

Whether it is starting the night with the 4-shot saturday s-co/lime special... or ending the night with a stella and goldfish...

Marcos the bouncer is a pimp, and the bartenders are friendly.

But forget all that, just the Nine-Iron Ryan dance contests in the back of the bar are enough to keep me coming back.
author: Adam O.

description:
Great place to catch a Giants game -- down-to-earth vibe and great bartenders at this lower pac heights neighborhood bar.  Solid standard Northern California beer selection on tap, a full bar to boot, and reasonable prices.

Chicken fingers and curly fries are not expensive and satisfy that craving when you've had a few too many to drink.

Place is small and can be very crowded during game days.
author: Mark K.

description: There's a "grill" in this post-college drinking dump? ok, I admit that's a little abrasive.  Let me re-phrase: there's a "grill" in this dump? Just kidding.  Its a good neighborhood joint, and the bartender and regulars were whooping it up and having a good ole' time when I came here for the first time for my alumni group's "Board Meeting". ha. I definitely appreciate the nightly $4 happy hour drink specials, and that they will give you pretty much whichever brand of alcohol you want in your happy drink.  Enjoyed watching the bartender hussy groping my fellow Board member too.
author: Rick H.

description:
It's time for me to Get Controversial.

The Fishbowl? It's Not All That Bad. No, seriously. I mean it. Granted, it sucked the first bunch of times I went there, & so I boycotted it. But then I went last Friday night. I walked through the front door on eggshells. I looked around suspiciously & noticed that...it wasn't overcrowded, the folks there were normalish looking (no fratboys or overdressed Marina-lite girls). Hell, I even witnessed three honest-to-God hipsters walk in. Hipsters in the Fishbowl? Yes. HIPSTERS IN THE FISHBOWL. So maybe the crowd is getting a little more diverse & a little less irritating. When the crowd isn't there to work against the establishment, I can't help but notice it's actually kind of pleasant.

My only complaint is that they should spice up the juke box with something besides Journey & the Red Hot Chili Peppers. If they put some old soul music & indierock in there as well, they might continue to draw a diverse, bro-free (or at least bro-limited) crowd.
author: Pete J.

description:
I used to think that I really liked this place but then a friend pointed out that I was always a 40 oz. deep and was still on a high from watching the latest episode of "The OC" before I went (Thursday nights).  I happened to stop by recently and it sucks.....
Also, it's under new management and they no longer allow patrons to dance on the bar and pour Jaigermeister shots directly into your mouth.
author: Steven M.

description:
I do not care for the scene at this bar. It attracts a homogeneous pool of late-20s to mid-30s people. I stick out like a yellow thumb in this crowd.  

The bar is extremely small yet gets extraordinarily packed. The only saving grace is that drinks are strong and cheap.

I made the mistake of coming here with a friend on a Friday night. We foolishly made our way to the back of the bar, stayed for maybe 20 minutes, and tried to make our way back through the crowd and towards the door. Unfortunately, a heavily intoxicated mite of a woman was blocking our path as she engaged in the most impassioned air guitar playing that I'd ever seen. She was so busy air-jamming with her eyes closed and body contorting that one of her friends had to nudge her to get her out of our way.  I think that pretty much says it all.
author: Jenny K.

description: Typical neighborhood bar scene. Probably need to come back on a more happening day at a more happening time... though one would think that it would be fairly busy on a Friday night.
author: Anna R.

description:
What sucks about writing this review is that I have to give the place at least a one star rating. If it were up to me I would give the Fish Bowl NEGATIVE stars.  The haggard over bleached bulimic America's next top model reject looks like she has spent most of her time laying in cancer beds than in bartender training. Last time I checked, bar tending was a customer service job. This broad makes it look like it's her career except that she's terrible at it, I recommend that she take up some literature on bartending for dummies. 

This place is Dive Bar Junkie Heaven. All the guys at the bar are regulars, sleaze balls, or douche bags. It's just a cock fest wannabe marina dive bar. If you start to have the least bit of fun, meaning begin to dance or sing to the jukebox, you'll get the evil glare from the bartender. Obviously, she's jealous because she's behind the bar at the age of 40 while all the younger girls are having a blast enjoying their youth. If it's so goddamn miserable, why don't you find a new hobby?  I strongly advise against coming here, read all of the reviews below, if you really want an awful dive bar hopping experience come here... or just save yourself from the agony.
author: c g.

description: I came here after work on a Friday evening. Surprisingly, it was not packed as I stepped through the door. I've always passed by this place on my way to work and never went inside. On this friday some friends we're celebrating a going away. They had like a $3 beer special which was cool. Blue Moon I ordered but they we're all out. Bummer. So, my next choice is a glass of Hefe. About 40 mins later and working on my 4th glass, I had a pretty good buzz going. They had a bunch of tv's playing baseball and the preseason game of the NFL. I think they served food there too, but I just came to socialize and drink. I would definitely come back one day. Still pretty shocked that there isn't much of a happy hour crowd on a Friday night...
author: Jeff C.

description:
Don't forget to wear your toga...I am surprised there are no beer bongs and ice luges integrated into the decor of this bar. The cheese factor is at an all time high and I'm not talking about the goldfish.  

The testosterone high vibe of the bar antagonized a game of bloody knuckles one night... with that being said you must get completely shit faced in order to really appreciate the crowd that surrounds you. So all you Winston, Biff, and Con$tington the III's  you have a place to sport your yachting jackets and pop you colla'.

Otherwise during the week it's a great neighborhood bar!

PS:  Richard, where are you?
author: Kristin F.

description: I went to this bar with a friend who knew someone who works there. This is probably the best bar I've been to so far in San Francisco that makes mixed drinks pretty good. Probably the best tasting Surfer on Acid I've had so far without the watered down taste I get from other bars and clubs. Nothing beats getting a free drink or two though if you have a friend who knows someone who works there. Even if you don't know anyone who works there, they have a "specials" for each day of the week like 4 SoCo Lime shots for $10 every Saturday. Goes down easy and a fast way to get buzzed if that's what you're looking to do.
author: Gerard Y.

description: Pretty much my favorite place for Friday Happy Hour with friends.  Good selection of beer on tap.  Good Juke Box.  Good fried appetizer stuff to share.   This place is for sure a win-win.
author: Jessica B.

description:
Things I look for in a bar:
Decent drinks for a decent price - check
Hooks under the bar to hang your handbag - check
Interesting people to converse with (ie hot guys:-P) - questionable
Atmosphere - also questionable

So this is a tiny bar on the edge of Pac Heights, pretty much overrun with young college types.  We had a good time despite the loud, obnoxious people in the bar.  I think I was old enough to be the bartenders mother, but other than that it was cool.

Unlikely to go back...but one never knows!
author: Melanie N.

description:
How many times can you leave your credit card on the bar and stumble home from a place before they finally tell you that you no longer have the mental capacity to own a credit card and they are keeping it? 
I will admit, I truly do love this place between the hours of 5 & 9. After that it's way too crowded and for some reason I then have to pee like every 15 minutes.  
If you go say Hi to my cousin Aidan he will be the Irish lad drinking beers on the end of the bar. (Really)
author: matt l.

description:
I wandered into this bar innocently enough- I happened to be exactly in front of the door when the thought occurred to me that I needed a Dark & Stormy.  
There was room at the bar so I sat down and was immediately shocked by the fact that the bartender came down to serve me.  What the..?  That never happens- I'm constantly stuck behind 4 girls who just turned 21 and have to ask about every drink in the place or else the bartender is busy cleaning glasses and calibrating his or her sphincter.

I recover from my shock in time to meet Stacy (note that there is no E) and she doesn't know what a Dark & Stormy is so I brace for twatittude, but lo- she reaches for a drink book and looks it up!  
(cue some spanish dude singing "I can be your hero baby")
Alas she does not have the ingredients for my bev of choice but she makes it up by pouring the most devilish concoction of rums my liver has ever tickled and then she does a round of graveyards on the house.  
My eyes still tear up when I think about it- no bartender has ever bought me a drink before- let alone everyone in the damn place.  That, my friends, is how you get 5 STARS.
So my one drink turned into a bunch and I left very drunk on a Thursday night- Casey doesn't work weekends so I didn't bother coming back until the following Monday where once again my "one quick drink" turned into a small aquarium's worth of Knob Creek.

So I don't have weekend experience here and I haven't lived in SF long enough to be a Marina hater so I'll just say everyone else in the bar was warm and fuzzy and the only one who took me home was my girlfriend- and I kind of expected that...

Update: I went back on a Saturday night and got the usual 'tude in an overcrowded sweatbox from a bartender whose brainscan would read:  cleavage=tips
and nothing else....  goodbye 5 stars...
author: Johnny G.

description:
Ok, the drinks are cheap and they've allowed some of my friends to guest bar tend in the past, which has been awesome (probably because they got us and themselves drunk on close to nothing) but I just cannot stand this place. It's smaller than my bedroom, ridiculously overcrowded with lame Marina douche-bags, and I once lost $5 playing dice at the bar top. Come on!! 

Ell, there is a bright side to the place, though. They serve you goldfish crackers. And when you're plastered at 1:15, that's exactly what you need..
author: Joe G.

description:
I came here after participating in my fist non-4th grade level dodgeball game. Thats right...dodgeball. Its intense. At this level of competition, there are refs, and there is even warming up! I not only managed to get my ass kicked by a teensy tiny girl many times over, but all of us also got ejected by the ref for mouthing off. We reasoned with him, and he did let us back in the game, but not before he mentioned that he always makes correct calls because he has refereed at dodgeball games *all across the country*!! Can you seriously make a career as a dodgeball ref?! Whoa. 

Anyways, I digress...but you can tell the night was a surreal experience, so me and the rest of the team needed to hit up some much needed beer.

This place adequatley provided a ton of beer, so I was completely satisfied. Jukebox was a little loud, but the tunes were cool. The jukebox may have been loud because it was someone's birthday party. I kept asking to see the birthday girl, but no one (not even the neighboring bar stool) would introduce me...that damn dodgeball ref must have told them all I was some kind of royal douche or something. Solid neighborhood dive bar...maybe not worth a special trip, but convenient if you are in the area.
author: Sean C.

description: I frequent Fishbowl about once a month for Friday happy hour. The key to really appreciating the Fishbowl is to manage your expectations. They are not trying to be trendy. They are not trying to be the NEXT big swank bar. They are a local neighborhood bar and do it well. The highlights here are the staff and reasonable costs! Which to be honest is something SF needs more of!
author: Ryan B.

description: Can you say, Rookie Trivia Champions!  Well it was only one night, but the first night there for trivia, and we won.  Granted, we had some help from the casual drinkers who were there to grab a few beers and ended up being drafted to our team, but a win is a win.  Also, the Chocolate Cake Shot is something that would make Martha Stewart proud....absolutely delicious!  The bartenders are cooler than the Vikings Stadium after that blizzard ripped a hole through the roof, and the drinks are reasonably priced.  They serve food within, and for whatever reason I always forget that fact (thus I have not tried it).  Each night carries a different theme, but there is a chalk board that can assist in identifying them.  I will certainly be making a return visit seeing as how the bartender owes me a shot.
author: Michael G.

description: Many years ago this was the loosest bar in the city. I didn't come here a ton, but once a month I'd spend an entire night getting loaded and getting up to no good in the bathroom, I mean, the place was just a shitshow. The  bartenders were crazy fun, the clientele was a fairly tighknit group of screw-ups and other bartenders, then the owners fired everyone. Many rumors why, but whatever the case, the bar went from a good North Bay kinda dive (like the bars you find in Cotati or Santa Rosa) to a typical date-rapey college bar, which is positioned on every four blocks in every town in everywhere America, which shroud be comforting for those craving Dayton, Ohio's cultural depth. Prices are fair, drinks are basic stuff, they used to pour Fernet into your mouth from the bottle, now they use glasses.....fair enough..
author: brant f.

description:
I wouldn't venture in on a weekend. I'm rarely in this neighborhood anyway (except to visit my dry cleaner, Sunshine Express, the best in the city), so it's not really worth complaining about the crowd at Fishbowl.

But I will say that it's mellow on weeknights, they serve food from Frankie's (so it's not really a grill... it's more they pirate someone else's grill), and they've got a Windermere Cup poster on the wall. So there are some redeeming factors.

Also, if it's your thing, the jukebox is pretty much "hits of the mid-90's."
author: Megan W.

description:
Here are the "goods"
    CHEAP drinks
    free goldfish
    good jukebox
    not crowded on weekdays
    Near Solstice
    CHEAP drinks

Here are the "bads"
   'Marina crowd' on weekends
    crowded in general bc the bar is small
    nasty bathrooms
    nasty hot dogs (I have never had one but have also never seen one being eaten which must mean everyone is afraid of them) 
   not-so-smart bartenders (male & female) - twice when I was here a guy bartender was getting in a fight with a drunk customer.
author: Jessica L.

description:
The Fishbowl feels like a 1am bar . . . but at 11pm.

Yeah, it gets a little rowdy, but if that's not your thing, maybe you could head on down to G-bar, Solstice or Lions Pub.

Personally, its got a great juke box and the bartenders occasionally serve free shots.  What's not to like?

As I side note, this has always been a second or third stop and never a first stop for the evenings events.
author: M S.

description:
Pretty cool bar. We go every Monday for trivia which is pretty evenly distributed across the spectrum. 50+ questions and actual prizes make it worthwhile. 

Probably be a good place for college or pro football, 4 big HD screens and good specials. Looking forward to the new menu.
author: Mark M.

description:
I always have a good time at Fishbowl.  Yeah, it can get crowded at times, but it's typically a friendly crowd.

I love the goldfish crackers, makes me feel like a kid again.  Staff has always been cool, and they always recognize my friends who live in the area.  Can't bet $2 bottles of Miller High Life in a city bar.  They have bar dice too, in case you get bored.

I don't know if I would commute halfway across the city for this bar, but I got a lot of friends in the Lower Pac Heights area, so we seem to frequent this place quite often.  Overall good neighborhood bar.
author: Bobby J.

description:
I love the Fishbowl, and I don't know why. 

It could be that my friends love this place, and sometimes it really feels like my own place where everybody knows your name. 

It could be that there's good beer on tap, a jukebox loaded with great music, and they stock the snack bowls with goldfish crackers.

It could very well be that they don't blink when 30 yellow shirted, drunk kickball players come in ordering tequila shots all around because "we almost won!"

 It might also be that they tend to turn a blind eye to any food I bring in (hello burrito place down the street!). 

It could also be that last cinco de mayo the bartender handed out Zorro masks to everyone in the bar. Classic.

Maybe minus a point for allowing my friends to guest bartend this Wednesday... the jury's still out!

Most importantly, I've never had a bad night here!
author: Kelly C.

description:
I love everything about the fishbowl. 
1) Orange fish crackers that sparked childhood memories
2) The strongest drinks ever!
3) Every time I go I am introduced to a different shot
4) A cute bartender named Izzy that is the most friendliest guy in the city
5) Its within walking distance
6) You can bring food in and they welcome it
7) They got the sports games on
8) A great juke box to grove too
9) Super laid back so you don't have to throw your heels on
10) You can sit with anyone there and they welcome you
So don't go there. You will hate it. :0)
author: Janine E.

description:
3 stars for sure.

Been here countless time but until this last Saturday I had yet to actually experience the "fishbowl" cocktail.  After attempting to finish drink what looked like neon blue "Adios Mother Fucker" I tried to pawn the rest off on the lovely ladies that inhabit this place on the weekends.  The roofie colada backfired and sent me into a happy yet belligerent tear through the city. I came out of my blackout sitting in a Chinese food restaurant in North Beach by myself at 2:30am. Thanks for letting feel like I was back in college again Fishbowl.
author: Adam L.

description:
I have read a couple of the review so far and most of the "I am looking for a quality man in a bar" girls don't seem to like it.  No duh Sherlock, it is a bar.  If you want an intellectual deep thinking man go hang out in the medical library or over at your nearest starbucks for the next Douche-Bag reading of John Keats.  Yet if you are looking to have a good time with fun people, go pre-party at the Fishbowl.

And FYI, I have been there a zillion times.  Do they really have food?  (Goldfish crackers don't count).
author: Piece O L.

description:
I had a great time here the other night. We had been out to dinner in the area and wanted to have a few more drinks, so my friend suggested this bar.
