When we got there, around 10:30 the place was not too crowded. We actually got a table within 5 Min's. The place filled up pretty quick, so I was happy that we had a place to sit. 
There was a pretty good mix of customers. Looked like a few regulars and a few groups of early 20"s. I thought the jukebox had a lot of great old tunes and the bartenders made some nice stiff drinks. 
Not sure I would go out of my way to come here, but if I was in the area, I would defiantly stop in!
author: Lisa A.

description:
I'm pretty big on The Fishbowl Bar...& Grill?!?!   SAY WHAT?!  I don't see no grillz.

As I was saying, I'm pretty happy that Fishbowl is within stumbling distance of my apartment.  I am sad that they don't serve their amazing Fishbowl drink in plastic fishbowls anymore, but it's still a pretty impressive (and tasty) deal.  Bonus star rewarded for the inclusion of a lot of those [probably cancerous] maraschino cherries in their adios-mofo-esque namesake cocktail.  *sigh* I love those little plastic-looking cherries.  

Hey bartender...please keep the goldfish crackers swimming my way!
author: Krystle S.

description:
This is my new favorite bar in the area.

A few people have complained about the new owners... They are AWESOME.  I got the chance to talk to them a little bit towards last call on a Saturday and they are, frankly, plainly nice people.  The guy with the curly hair, as some repugnant naysayer below called him, is on top of his shit, a foodie and chef, and a nice guy.  The only people he was rude to on the jam-packed night I was there were a couple of guys starting a fight.  He literally grabbed them and threw them out.  The guy kicks ass.

It's small and cozy, so far everyone I've met there has been friendly, even the doorman is friendly.

Whenever I go to Divis, this is the bar I end at.  I get there around 12 and it caps off the night gloriously.  I suggest trying that yourself!
author: Gavin S.

description:
I went to Fishbowl thinking that it was a pet store that sold fish, I ended up getting drunk and the next day had a hangover but no pet fish...

...if you actually believed that story, you are gullible, which by the way, is not in the dictionary!

I went to Fishbowl on a Thursday night, and was very surprised how big of a crowd there was for a Thursday! They have a fish tank w/ a Red Stripe bottle in it behind the bar, although I'm not sure if there are actual fish. They also have bowls of Pepperidge Farm Goldfish crackers on the bar tables, how cute and fitting. The crowd was pretty young, a bunch of USF students as well as some people probably in their late 20s, early 30s. The people there were friendly and dressed casually. This is your typical neighborhood bar and is not huge, but feels nice and cozy. Around 11:00pm, the bartenders got up on the bar with bottles of Jaeger and were pouring shots into people's mouths, awesome! That's a good way to get people drunk...lucky for the bartenders, they weren't drunk, because it definitely would not be hard to fall off the bar and that would hurt.

I'm sure I will go back to Fishbowl in the near future, but it's just a pain to get to since I live all the way in South Beach!
author: Elaine S.

description:
$7 22 oz. red stripes are not a good deal for happy hour.
$3 12 oz. PBRs are an even worse deal for happy hour.

have 1 measly fish bowl in a bar named fishbowl isn't very wild.

the best part of this place is the tiny bathroom, because it actually looks grungy unlike the rest of the bar which seems to strive for this look but fails miserably
author: Victor B.

description: Every time I come up here the vibe is soo welcoming that I end up wasted telling high school sports stories. And as all stories go i usually end up lying and making half of the details and names up. This makes for a few uncomfortable moments on my next visit, but it is short lived as undoubtedly the shots will be flying off the bar again and we will start the process all over.
author: Dru P.

description:
This is the closest bar to me, so I'm surprised it took me 6 months to get here.  I went for trivia night, and had no idea what was in store for me: after many $2 beers, blue drinks and Patron shots I challenged the two Irish guys sitting next to me to a drinking competition.  What an idiot I am.  Hours (and one brief Irish makeout session) later, I was on my way home way more wasted than I planned to be on a Monday night.
I'm taking off a star 'cause the bar's nothing special and the bartender wasn't too chatty, but it's a nice local place and big kudos to hosting Brainstormer trivia.  And Irish guys.
author: Kim K.

description:
I spent a few hours here on a Saturday night and luckily we were able to nab a table near the front of the bar.   I parked my ass there the whole time and enjoyed the rest of the night.  I didn't explore around the bar or check out the crowd...I was too busy enjoying my company.

I must say though, the drinks were totally reasonably priced which I loved!!
author: Vivian W.

description:
1 star - Happy Hour - 3 dollars for all beers - good selection on draft
1 star - cool jukebox lots of choices 
1 star - instead of bowls of peanuts  they have bowls of goldfish

Went here for Happy Hour after work.  Nice enough for after work beers.  I doubt I would travel specifically here to get my drink on, but it definitely works as a local bar or if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Jenn A.

description:
Oh how I still heart the fishbowl, but alas new ownership has come through....

It's no longer the watering hole I once knew with neighborhood night and guest bartenders. It's now a spot where instead of fish crackers on the tables, Art is hung on the walls (not complaining - but the crackers were classic) and instead of the Divisadero Ale House sign there are flat screen tv's galore..... ahhh I suppose things change. 

On a positive note. the new owners are good about keeping the bar stocked and a bit cleaner than before, but it's definitely a new vibe...I'll have to try it out a few more times before making a final decision, so stay tuned!
author: Summer C.

description:
The Fish Bowl is the kind of bar where you can:
*Wear flip-flops
*Make nice-nice with the bartender and he will pour you free (and tasty) shots that he has concocted
*Eat bowls and bowls of goldfish
*Split a fishbowl and then dare your friend to go to the bathroom and put her underpants over her jeans...which she does, no problem.

The Fish Bowl is also the kind of bar where:
*Loud, annoying girls screech in your ear
*Guys either push you or give you a molest-y grope while they make their way across the bar 
*Dudes start conversation in the following manner: "Where are you going?  Wanna go back to my place?"...slick...real slick.

The Fish Bowl is the kind of place you'll either want to drink for 4 hours straight or you'll want to get the hell out immediately.  Fortunately, I've had more better times than worse here.  Definitely better on the weekdays than the weekend.
author: Ellen B.

description:
Under new ownership the place has some pros and cons-

Pros: The new owner is from back east, which means Red Sox games on the big screen!

Cons: There appears to be some attitude that was missing from the bar's previous incarnation.  There also appears to be some confusion on how a vodka gimlet should be made (I'm usually a beer girl but everyone needs to switch it up occasionally).  Three ingredients, ice, one glass...hell, I'll even take it on the rocks, and you can even call it a kamikaze if it helps.  Ah well, hopefully they'll get there, and lose some 'tude in the process.

In the meantime, I'll still be there for cheap happy hour and sox games.
author: caitlin c.

description:
Went here specifically for the Fishbowl drink because I had heard that they serve it to you in a fishbowl. And, I thought that would be sooo awesome!

They don't serve you the drink in a fishbowl. =( But the drink is okay (not so great quality booze, but good flavor). We had a few of these, and the bartender made us a "panty-dropper" for our last pitcher. 

Start of a great night.
author: Sue Y.

description:
It's nice to get out of the downtown area for an after work gathering from time to time.  The Fishbowl is where we ended up one time, and after the craziness of the downtown happy hour scene, the laid back scene here was a refreshing change.

They offer food from the restaurant next door and there are daily drink specials.  Although the Friday special was 4 kamikazes, and with a group of three people there is always someone who's getting two drinks.  That, combined with my lack of skills at dice games meant it was a difficult post bar evening...

Still, the staff was friendly and was able to provide some dice for our table.  Which I'm not sure helped me out, but our group had a good time.
author: Jared W.

description:
Well, it's a bar. It's small. Not particularly special except the standard friday/saturday patrons are a pretty standard marina crowd.

Definetly a reasonable destination if you are already in the neighborhood, hopefully because you live down the street, and it's a random weekday evening. I've heard tell that ordering 'the fish bowl' is a dangerous proposition that will define the rest of your day. Be warned.
author: Rhett G.

description:
Oh! The Fishbowl. I used to live a block from this joint and there is something so appealing about convenience. Now I don't live there anymore. Why then, would I subject myself to such a craptastic bar?

side note - bar AND GRILL??? they serve food here? or are they talking about how you go to frankie's and bring fries back when you have 1am munchies? or are they referring to the goldfish crackers served at each table? wtf.
author: Valerie N.

description:
Well I saw this one coming. Last night the infamous YELLOW team paraded into Fishbowl and had the privilege of bring served up by the best bartender in the City. HUGE shout out to Summer!

Again, when you're surrounded by friends and a sea of yellow, life can't get any better.

Fishbowl, thanks for hosting a great after party, and yes... I will be back.
author: Mike K.

description:
This place is going to grow on me...I have a feeling. 

My awesome work buddies and I came here for a much needed (understatement) hump day happy hour. We ordered beaucoup de ciders, which were tasty. I don't think I knew ciders were clear and look like sparkling water sorta....dangerous. 

Anyways, it's a fun spot to hang out at, especially when you can grab a table and some stools. However, yesterday, they were playing the music so loud I could not hear what anyone was saying. And they were out of 7 beers (yes, 7, because my friend tried to order 7 different ones). Other than that, it's a very laid back spot in a fun neighborhood....and you can order munchies from Frankie's Bohemian Cafe next door. Cheers!
author: Laura D.

description:
Great place to go to if you want to get shitfaced really cheap. I haven't really gotten as wasted as I did last nite in a long time. I didn't get to try the fishbowl which is apparently all you really need for a nite out on the town. But, one person probably can't drink that damn thing. 


As far as the crowd, it's got some frat/sorority feel to it. But, people were friendly. This seems like a great place to either start a nite or to stay and get completely trashed.
author: Srinivas R.

description:
OK,

I should really hate this place.  But somehow I manage to have a blast when I go.

Granted I discovered it and had my first pleasant experiences on relatively chill weeknights.  On weekend nights it truly is sausage central in which case you can just cruise up to solstice.
author: Jay W.

description:
I've tried and tried to make this my "bar" but I can't convince enough of my friends to come hang out in my neighborhood, so I probably go there once a month. That being said, every time I go in and tell the staff my hopes and aspirations to be their newest regular, they are encouraging and pour me lots of very strong (sometimes on the house) drinks. I'm serious everytime I say it and they encourage me each time and are delightfully friendly and entertaining. I love a place that isn't snobby, you know? And this definitely fits the bill. None of that holier than thou bs you get at some bars. 

Not to mention the ordering food next door situation. Pretty sweet. 

I'm not giving it 5 stars just because I feel like if it was truly the best bar ever I'd be inclined to go there more often. Did I mention I stopped drinking so much? That's probably got nothing to do with this wonderful bar.
author: Elsa E.

description: I really like Fish Bowl!  I mean, it's a dive, but thank god there is a dive bar in Pac Heights, I really need somewhere to meet friends that I don't have to get all dressed up for.  Last time I went there were 2 bartenders, I wish I remembered their names, but they were great- friendly, even came around to refill our drinks when we were sitting at a table.  I need to try their bar food.  Last time I was starving and kept smelling other people's food. . . I really need to eat when I drink!
author: Muriel D.

description: this place was awful. the bartender was the local "lady of the night" hitting on everyone. it was really creepy. we even her the bartender tell a patron that was there with his girlfriend she wanted to F him, so creepy.  the door guy was alright, he just sits there. i wouldn't go back or recommend this place, there are tons of better places to grab a drink.
author: M M.

description:
Typical neighborhood bar. Redeeming factors include Wyder's Cider on draft and Marcos, the awesome door guy. He kept me a lot of company while I watched my totally inebriated friend make an ass of himself and frighten girls. Thank goodness reinforcements showed up to help me save his sloppy ass! 

Overall, I think it would have been more fun if:
1. I had been as drunk as my friend. Maybe not, I don't think I would remember it actually...
2. I was with more people/had the opportunity to meet more people.

Would give it a whirl again some time. After all, I got to arm wrestle a total stranger at the bar (I let him win).
author: Irene F.

description: "woooooooo-girls" found here. Small place with frat ambiance. Take it as you will. I will come here with a large crowd for 2 drinks and then move on.
author: Edmund C.

description: Perfect neighborhood spot for beers. Good, friendly staff and great juke box. But no need to destroy our eardrums with the volume at 5pm, dudes.
author: Tripp S.

description:
I did a guest bartender gig here in December of '03 when this bar was a 5 star joint.  Back then the jukebox rocked classic rock and the crowd was sorta diverse and the drink specials were good. 

I just went back the other night and I didn't love love love it anymore.  Whoever the new owners are sure took the warm, homey & comfortable feeling right outta there. Plus the bartender was overbearing and assholey.
author: Mimi S.

description:
I went on a Tuesday night with a friend and it was not crowded at all. The bartender seemed to be having fun because everyone was buying her shots. She remained attentive so I really did not care how many shots she had. I did not try the food but the happy hour was great. I would try this bar again on a weekend night.

Oh, the free goldfish were a nice touch.
author: E P.

description:
The only reason I like this place is becasue I want some fried food with my beer, and they have by far some of the best places to get bar food for cheap at a bar. Other than that, if I wanted to hang out with frat boys and serority girls I would move back to San Luis Obispo... or to the Marina, haha. It can get kinda loud sometimes, but that's okay on the weekends, it is a bar afterall.

No, it's my neighborhood bar and I relaly do like going there for a quick drink with my roomates.. when I don't feel like being somehwere quiet.
author: evan Y.

description:
So, let's be honest, I've fallen into a rut where I don't leave Polk Street. I mean, everything you could possibly want is on that street. Plus, it's a block away from my home.

Well, after some major cajoling from a good pal (I think it probably involved some bribing with her yummy food), I decided to leave my home and venture far far away to the Fishbowl. 

All in all, I'm glad I did. The ambiance is laid back and chill, the bartenders are cool, and I met a very cute boy there the first time I went (unfortunately, he turned out to be certifiably INSANE, but you win some, you lose some).

If you come on trivia night, expect to play trivia or leave. It's just not worth it squeezing yourself in there while people are madly huddled together  scribbling on their pieces of paper.
author: Ava S.

description:
i really shouldn't be putting this on yelp...hands down best bar trivia in the city

-real prizes for 1st, 2nd, and 3rd place
-top-notch announcing
-actually winnable (combination between size of venue and choice of questions)
-cool bartender 
-reasonable start time

TV's are a distraction during trivia, but I can imagine they're nice on gameday (hopefully the two don't coincide).
author: LJ W.

description: This place used to be a really fun and crowded place to visit but it now nothing like what it once was. No more awesome drink specials and about half the fun.
author: Jaron W.

description:
The Fishbowl is a phenomenal local bar.  It's a small hole in the wall that plays good rock music and has cheap drinks.  With $3 High Life's can you really go wrong?  No, you can't...  The people there are affable folks.  I've never gotten into a fight with a random stranger over how my eyes have a tendency to stray towards their girlfriend's love bunnies at the Fishbowl, which is nice.  And Marco, the bouncer, rocks. 

It's the perfect place to meet up with your girlfriend after a big fight to have make up drinks.
author: Aaron P.

description:
Live in SF now, near Fishbowl.  Still a weekend staple.
------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This place is pretty cool.  Whenever I come to party in SF with a certain group of friends we always end up here.  At this point in the night nobody in the group needs any more drinks. The next morning, for some reason my last memory of the night is being at the Fishbowl.  
Always crowded.  Strong drinks (See above).  They have cool tables with ocean maps in them (I think these are from the old Chart House).  I ran into some college friends which was a surprise.  
Overall I'd recommend checking it out.
author: Dave B.

description:
Despite some other positive reviews, my experience here was not a positive one and i will not be coming back. I attended the bar with a group of friends, we took a table by the window, because it was hot inside the bar, its small. When it came my turn to buy drinks i gladly did, ordering 3 signature Fish Bowls, and a handful of other cocktails for my group, including one for the man who sits a the corner of the bar. The bartender was rude, and slow. When i ordered she said "I love making fishbowls" in a very sarcastic tone. She pretty much threw the drinks at me when they were ready, i paid with my CC, and did not leave a tip. She was rude, spilled my drinks, and really blew me off. A moment after returning to my table, the bouncer kicked me out of the bar claiming that i had verbally abused the Bartender. 

Talk about some BS, she was upset that i hadn't left her a tip on a $60 dollar ticket. I've worked in the Food "Service" industry, tips not mandatory, gotta earn it. 

I'll Never go back, and I'll try to talk anyone who's thinking about going there to into someplace other than there.
author: Michael K.

description:
Met some friends at the Fish Bowl this past Sunday. They had been drinking for a while alreaady, so Izzy the bartender made sure I caught up to them pretty quickly.   Needless to say, I had a blast!

The place was pretty empty except for a our group and a few really friendly people sitting at the bar.  Since I live in the Mission I don't know if I would make the Fish Bowl a regular stop, but I would definitely go back.
author: Lorena G.

description: The bartenders intentionally over charge clients here.  It has happened to a number of my friends.  I spoke with the owner and he promised it was a mistake and he would reimburse me.  Three phone calls later and i still have not been reimbursed.  If you want to get ripped off at a bar that is shitty anyway go there.  Otherwise I recommend one of the other bars in the area.
author: Jim L.

description:
Dive bar with little space to sit and even less space to stand around in.  Basically, a hallway with several round tables abutted against one side of the wall.  The beers on tap seemed a bit watered down.  I probably could have had 20 and not felt any alcoholic after effects.

Wednesday night's neighborhood night and thankfully so.  It wasn't crowded and my group managed to get seats which was impressive in itself.
author: Eileen Q.

description:
they have an awesome jukebox. I was taught if you have nothin nice to say then don't say anything at all haha. But I totally see what everyone else is talking about I will say.

I'd go again but wouldn't make plans to go there like it's gonna be a highlight of my night
author: tony c.

description: Just moved into the neighborhood and already a fan. Good strong drinks, lots of TVs, crispy tator tots - yum, and the bartenders are relaxed and fun. It's a small space so get there early if you want a place to sit and watch a game or two.
author: Sarah S.

description: I have to say that I really liked this place! Met up with some friends just to watch March Madness and we ended up staying for quite a while. The bartenders were really nice and awesome, their happy hour is decent, and the atmosphere is great. I ordered some wings, and that went over well. I don't usually see Mirror Pond on tap, but I loved that they had it. It's just a great place to go to hang out, drink, and watch sports with your friends and a couple of neighborhood people.
author: Caroline L.

description: Take Frankies next door, paint it blue, take away the food and cooler music and add mixed drinks, an obnoxious crowd, and pepperidge farm goldfish and you've got the Fishbowl. You can order food from the kitchen next door though, which is nice.
author: matthew r.

description: This is one of the greatest bars on earth.  The drinks are super strong and the bartenders are awesome.  It's like going to a gay bar and getting hard drinks, cept there's no gays there.  This place makes me gay-as in happy, not gay gay.
author: christopher h.

description: I live close by and would like for this place to be good, but it just isn't.   IS there any reason for the volume of the music to be so freaking loud??  I went in recently and the bar was dead, but still the music was mindsplittingly loud.  I mean the bar is only 12x12.   It's not like the couple in the corner can't hear the music. The music selection is eclectically 1995 top 40 bad.  The average age of the patrons is 19, and the average drunkeness is very stinking drunk.  I felt like I needed to take a shower when I came out of this bar.
author: Spencer G.

description:
Another review I think must've suspiciously disappeared from my Yelp repertoire.  I remember my first ice flinging review clearly, and yet. . . . not here.  Odd.
I avoid the Fishbowl at all costs normally, and I certainly don't go anywhere near it during peak bar hours.  I am far too old to tolerate the "very very new to drinking legally in bars" crowd, even if they are good for my ego as they typically get so drunk that they end up hitting on me.  I can only imagine that through beer goggles (or rather 2 for 1 drink special goggles) I look 10 years younger and 20 pounds thinner.  Or perhaps your potential suitor will throw ice at your table all night to get your attention.  Is this the high school cafeteria?  Did I miss something?  Yeah, they have drink specials, and sometimes the crowd doesn't entirely suck, but that happens about as often as total solar eclipses happen.
The only redeeming quality is that you can have food from Frankie's next door delivered to you on your barstool, and the only upside to that is if you were in the mood for hard alcohol with your food since Frankie's doesn't serve liquor.
All in all, I'd rather a) sneak a flask into Frankies, or b) get my food from Frankie's to go and head home; both of these are moot points really since who the hell drinks hard alcohol with a burger?!
author: Jennifer D.

description: You're asking for trouble if you get the blue pitcher of Fishbowl... argh.
author: Susanna D.

description:
i used to like this bar.

but now i basically hate it, on principle. because one of my ex-boyfriends works there now, and he is a total doo-doo face.
author: Irene S.

description: This bar reminds me of being in college, except with worse highlights and more STUBBORN BELLY FAT (sorry, I watch a lot of TV and needed to throw a Relacore informercial reference out at least once in my life).  Fishbowl is where the people who say college was the "best five years of [their] life" go to drink.
author: Jess T.

description: One Fish, Two Fish, Red Fish, Blue Fish... Looks like this one has a little Gold Fish! Maybe it is just me but the peanuts at the bar have proved to be a dirty dirty idea, right? Statistics even show the amount of germs on the public peanuts. News flash... Fishy Bowl, Gold Fish are no different and can't hide from the germs just because they are a light yummy delight. But what the hey, everyone that goes there is just looking to get wasted or drink until the person next to them doesn't look like they are sleeping in the streets tonight. My only thought of this bar is, it could be a hot spot if I lived next door, but other then that I don't plan on going back unless my roommate drags me to a 21st bday party. Don't worry if your friends are under age, they don't check id's at the door. Have your friends buy you a cocktail. Anything flies here, even the mermaids.
author: Dee C.

description: the only reason i give this place even one star is because they play every giants game....otherwise, unless  ur a douche bag its not the place for you.
author: Ruca R.

description: I am totally skeptical of all SF bars but this was the fist bar in SF that I've found where I didn't hate myself for being at. Pabst in a can and a rally shot of Jamesons with the bartender who, I swear would bleed black and orange. Only regret is that the rally shot didn't help the giants out, maybe I should have made it a double. Two thumbs up.
author: Tristan K.

description: We started out with low expectations.  That's the beauty of dive bars.  Cheap drinks and the company makes up for the rest.  We ordered a couple of waters.  For the record, they do not have sparkling water (ha!).   My friend asked for it and the bartender replied "This is a dive bar.  We don't have sparkling water."  My friend's response, "Well, they have sparkling water in gay bars!"  So true, so true.
author: Krista C.

description: Imagine being at a frat party, and not the kind you see in animal house, the kind where every one is in love with two things.  Them selves, and Dave Mathews.  I couldn't have been in a more uncomfortable place.  Packed house couldn't, shoulder to shoulder butts to nuts.  Pretenion abound from both the men and women, please people get over your selves your not that special.  I would love to give this place no stars, alas this is not an option, but one star will be suffice, the bartender was kinda cool and bought me shots of fernet which makes it ok in the end.
author: brian m.

description: This place gets two stars because I liked the way it looked inside. That's the only reason why I haven't given it only 1. I went on a Thursday, around 10pm, and the place was so packed the door wouldn't even shut. And at 10pm these people were beyond wasted already. Think Kells type people. Obnoxious men, once again with absolutely NO etiquette. kept getting jabbed in the back by a guy who was clearly trying to just make more room for himself since he was by the door, not caring that I was getting smashed into the bar. I felt like I was in a mosh pit.
author: Marina K.

description: A solid bar, great happy hour, great selection on tap.  Bartenders are chill, there are flatscreens with your favorite game on. Just a really good go to bar to have a drink, meet up with friends, or grab some bar food as well. Always a classic in my heart.
author: Heather M.

description: I used to really like this place but lately I feel like its full of really drunk, really young, frat boys.  Maybe I am just not as drunk as I used to be but I don't appreciate guys throwing stuff at us to get our attention when my friends and I just want to grab a drink.  Guys, not the best mode of flirtation since elementary school.  Still like the goldfish aspect and that you can order food from Frankies next door.
author: Lindsay P.

description: Never excited to hear that friends are going to "The Bowl".  Jaeger on my shirt; mad dudes all up on the walls.  Sounds like a good time, Garth--not!
author: Robby T.

description: Small, crowded, loud, and generally unbearable Thurs-Sat nights.  More comfortable on schoolnights.
author: Cully W.

description: This place is pretty fun, the ambiance is chill and the crowd is mixed which I like. I was expecting more Marina crowd but it was nicely diverse. Plus they have goldfish crackers at the bar! Also conveniently, there is lots of parking nearby!
author: Cathy T.

description: Up until about a year and a half ago, the Fishbowl was one of my favorite "go-to" places in the city, mostly because I live only two blocks away.  Ever since they changed ownership I saw a steep increase in the amount of people who aren't really very classy but dress up in nice clothing to mask their true selves (i.e. db's and marina snobs).  I'm not trying to be mean, but it's true.  The point where I said "I'm never coming here again" was when what looked like a MAC make-up representative pushed me away from the bar and tried to start a fight with me because she didn't like the shirt I was wearing.  I know, I don't get it either.  But I came here last Friday night to meet up with some friends and it was surprisingly tolerable.  At the end of the day they have cheap drinks and bottomless bowls of goldfish, so I'm willing to give Fishbowl another try.
author: Michelle L.

description: This place kinda sucks.  The least good option of the three full service bars in the area (Solstice, Lions Pub, Fishbowl).  In fact I think it's safe to say I hate the Fishbowl.
author: Jon M.

description: Going to the Fishbowl is like hanging out with your best friend - it's impossible not to have a great time.  It's always fun, the drinks are always strong, and the jukebox is always chock-full of favorites.  The biggest plus is that it's only a few blocks away from me.  However, it no longer seems like just a neighborhood bar but instead has become a destination.  Nonetheless, it is a great bar option for those who want to have "just a drink" on a mellow night...only to find themselves belting along to Bon Jovi.  No matter what, chances are you'll leave Fishbowl when the lights come on, and drunker than you expected to be.  That's what friends are for.
author: Louis M.

description: If you like good looking bartenders thinking they're in "Coyote Ugly" and miss the Santa Barbara frat scene...this place is for you!  Have to admit it's a pretty fun, rowdy crowd to be around if you need to rally energy for the night.
author: Tanger T.

description: A neighborhood bar leaning toward the divey side...about as murky as the fish-tank resting behind the counter. However, almost anyplace with a jukebox is on extremely good terms with me. Regrettably, I never got  to hear my three tunes play and I was there for at least an hour, odd. I noticed a few twenty to thirty-something couples sprinkled about, everyone having a good time and engrossed in conversation. My vodka cran(s) were made well and my bartender never ever left me hangin'. Eventually I'll return to give the box and the bowl another try.
author: Malika K.

description: This is THE watering hole for the marina/pac heights crowd.  But instead of thinking 'party time,' I always feel a bit gross when I Ieave here because it seems like I never go here for a good reason anyways.  Not a fan....
author: Yelper A.

description: I have never had a bad experience here. Cool peeps, cheap drinks, sweet vibe. Love this local watering hole. Last weekend I rolled in with a few friends to celebrate President's Day with some day drinking. To be greeted with $2 drinks, what more does one want with Monday off, a new President and some much needed rain? It was a delightful Sunday indeed.
author: Jen B.

description: Great local dive, it is where we always go for a beer. Brandon, I believe his name is, and the other new owners have oyster sunday and other fun days now. They have people inside playing games (i have also heard that they sometimes play wii on the flatscreen), good music, fun specials,  and a good time is all I can ask for.
author: Sydel S.

description: Do you own several striped shirts? Like to do Jager bombs with your bros? Well dude, get your ass down to Fishbowl and get tanked!!  Jukebox is ok, and it's not a bad place to grab a drink during the week, but if it's a Friday/Saturday night, forget about it... unless you want to fight your way through the door and are a fan of the "Sausage Fest"
author: Chris B.

description: Cheep drinks.  Poor atmosphere.  Mediocre bartenders.  I will admit the cheesy goldfishes at the bar makes up for it a little, but the atmosphere is just really bad.
author: Max M.

description:
Here are some highlights from my nights at the fishbowl:

- Friend A - Drank the fishbowl by himself, proceeded to projectile vomit out the door of the bar on to customers standing on the sidewalk and several parked cars.
- Friend B - Slipped on a spilled drink (not hers) and cut her forehead before storming out of the bar in a rampage
- Friend C - To date, has fallen completely off a bar stool, backwards,  4 times, totally embarrassing her friends each time
- Friend D - Was asked twice by the bartender to please stop eating ALL of the goldfish and leave some for the rest of the patrons

So, all in all, I'd call this a pretty fun dive bar.
author: Caedmon P.

description:
I love the fact that right next door is Frankie's Bohemian, so Fishbowl has the unique talent of being right next to a lot of garlic but still smelling like beer and cologne (the smell of success :)
My friend Heather says that the Fishbowl is the perfect Newport dive bar - somehow this fabulous beach bar has been transplanted on Divis, but it's chill, the drinks are strong, and if Lion's Pub is just too freaking crowded, it's a nice alternative for some libations.
author: Anjali K.

description: I constantly wonder why people go here!  But then again, why was I here??  Oh yea, cuz we were piss drunk wanted to get cheap drinks, and eat goldfishies.  That's the only thing great about the place.  Jodie is an AWESOME bartender too.  Her lady co-worker wasn't so hot and gave bad attitude all night.  And more bad attitude when we tried to give the place another chance two days later!
author: Sweet Mother of Mary O.

description: Goldfish at the tables is a nice touch. Not sure how clean they are though...it's like the bar nuts stories you see on TV when they take a sample back and find all kinds of weird crap in it. Anyways, place had some good drink specials and some good beer on tap. The crowd definitely was a local crowd.
author: Mike C.

description: I can imagine that this place is a disaster on Fri/Saturday nights, but during the week it's actually a fairly chill place to grab a drink after work.  It's casual (I don't feel weird showing up in medical scrubs), they have good happy hour specials, and they give you goldfish to soak up the beer.
author: Katie S.

description:
First of all, im 30 (read: not some 21 year old a**hole), I have been here more than a dozen times as I am an avid fan of Frankies next door, and i happened to be sober on the night in question. Just the association with frankies is worth a point in my book. The day of the time change ("spring forward") we went there at 1:32 am after spending 3 hours earlier in the night at Frankies. I ordered two beers, was served promptly, tipped $4, and immediately upon sitting down, was tapped on the shoulder by a pony-tailed bouncer and told to wrap it up. It was 1:33. I told him i would be happy to leave upon finishing my beer. At 1:35, ive knocked back about half of the beer with haste in an effort to placate the bouncer, when I was grabbed by the shoulder and told that it's time  to go. We proceed to debate (in an effort to give me time to finish my beverage) 1) the rationale for serving me only to kick me out immediately, 2) how some sort of fractional rebate system was in order, and 3) why this was necessary as it wasn't close to 2am. All those things that you would do if you were confronted in such a manner. Were they required to close at 1, and had overrun their alloted time? That would have been a perfectly reasonable response, but instead we were left without answers. Im not an argumentative person and wasn't trying to give the guy a hard time, but i was incredulous as to the situation. Seemingly realizing the folly of his ways, he apologized, ordered us two shots of the whiskey and took one with us. We were more than happy to leave at that point, feeling vindicated, until he looked me square in the eyes and angrily told us to "Get the F*** out". We were on the way out the door anyway, so this secured the need for a review. 

Everyone else here has always been perfectly nice. I would go 2 & 1/2 stars, but am staying true to the definition of "Meh. I've experienced better" that yelp has provided. Maybe the guy had a bad night, but I can't remember being treated more poorly at a bar.
author: Bennett C.

description: Love this bar, cheesy goldfish, pack house, the owner Richard is really cool! Guest bartendering nights.... cute girls and good drinks!
author: Stanley K.

description: Do you like to drink until you vomit?  You've come to the right place.
author: Jackson R.

description: Came in here with two friends to get drinks on a Monday.  We were able to sit at a table and took advantage of the $2 (or was it $3?) Dos Equis.  We hung out and chatted and the bartender comped my friend a few drinks when he mentioned he had just moved into the neighborhood.  Bathrooms weren't too clean, but it's a dive bar... what can you expect.
author: Liz A.

description: This place is fun ... a tad loud on the weekends, but fun. Just make sure when you go there with your crew that next time you choose not to be the DD. We walked in to "Welcome to the Jungle" bouncing off the walls and a girl on the bar pouring jager shots into her victum's mouths. I liked the closenss of this place, but yes, I was put-off by the crowd who filled in the gaps as the night went on ... looks like the Marina folks can get bored with Cosmos after all. Too bad they know about Divisadero.
author: Amanda C.

description: Again, love the boys here.  Good bar food when you're getting hammered, hot dogs and chicken nuggets are my fav.  Come see the guest bartenders Wednesday night, yes, it's back on!
author: Jennifer N.

description: Great for happy hour, insanely cheap drinks and cute bartenders, ladies. Goldfish crackers to munch on. Local crowd makes it way less obnoxious than other bars and it's a great place to chill without having to run into the Marina crowd.
author: Nicole S.

description:
Last time I was at the Fishbowl, the bathroom was just beginning to flood.  So not only was I expected to drink like a fish, but it was assumed that I should swim like one, too.

Regardless of rising waters, I like the Fishbowl.  The jukebox is loud, but the attitude of the place is that you should be singing along---not talking---anyway.  There are nightly drink specials, and goldfish crackers and hot food served from a cut-out window in the back to help save you from drowning in your bar tab ("when your judgment's on the brink").
author: Hannah J.

description: Not such a bad place. Good drinks, some beautiful women and great bartenders. Only gets 3 stars for being crazy loud and packed sometimes... wait maybe I am getting old... damn... nope it's the bar, 3 stars it is. :)
author: Robert A.

description: I get drunk here about once a month, drink a gallon of Fernet, do horrible things in the bathroom, get drunker, drunkely chatter with my drunken co patriots, hit on the bartender, eat free goldfish, usually remember nothing, assume I had a good time, never sure how I managed to spend so little money but be that drunk, am OK with that, stumble home, stumble back one month later, repeat, yay!!
author: Steve l.

description: Great drinks, great staff, and even better jukebox. The only time I could foresee a problem here is if you are male and happen to need to take care of some business in the bathroom department. You'll be S.O.L. as there's barely a urinal attached to the wall...
author: Nicolas H.

description: I'll easily give this place four stars because their drinks are cheap and strong. Strong as in I usually gag on the first drink b/c it's 95% booze and 5% mixer, after that it's smooth sailing to getting bent. The bartenders are fast and attentive, easy to speak to and no attitude. For that I'll give this place another star and continue to come back and get drunk. BTW, don't worry about the drunk Marina shitheads, they usually get thrown out pretty quickly.
author: Gary T.

description: Sure it's loud and full of young 23-year old Marina kids.  But the Fishbowl is fun, friendly, and serves Pepperidge Farm goldfish as you tip back your bud light.  Order food from next door at Frankie's and they'll bring it on over.  Go to the Fishbowl for a casual beer with a couple friends.  It will make you feel young again.  Either that, or really, really old.
author: Lija H.

description: We were in here last night and realized we were not  nearly drunk enough. Everyone there was SLOSHED. Which was great. Some were wearing sunglasses. It was like semi-frat party but in an ok way some how. The bartender asked if she could have a smoke before getting us drinks, and then asked me if she could butt in front of me to use the bathroom. I thought that was great for some reason. I was thinking it is right in the middle between Mauna Loa and Delaney's - perfectly. Anyway it's a solid bar. We'll be back.
author: Sarah R.

description: You can walk into the bowl with $20 and walk out of there wasted!!!  The best bang for your buck in the city. Although you do need to rally some energy because it can get a little crazy with randoms dancing on the bar
author: Monique O.

description: Great for a laugh on a Thursday night.  During their "promo night", Bacardi girls pass out beads & bandannas and the oh-so-trendy clientele can't wait to wrap them around their heads or strap them on their biceps.  If it wasn't for the pitcher of liquor they call a "Fishbowl", I might have found the situation a little sad.  Instead, I enjoyed the entertainment as I jammed to the 80's on the jukebox and sipped my blue concoction.  The staff was nice, the drink was good, and no one seemed to realize how ridiculous they looked, so it was an O.K. night in my book!
author: Tara G.

description: By far one of the best bars in the city!! Every time I go there I end up stumbling out in the wee hours of the morning...you just can't help it there. The drinks are really strong, the crowd is good lookin and the bartenders are cheeky! Where else in the city can you get free fish crackers and a bowl full of fowl blue booze. Awesome, just totally awesome!
author: Chloe D.

description: This is a nice neighborhood bar - went here a couple of times when I first got here for events. I'd rate this as a great place to make your local hangout, but I would not describe this as a bar to make a special trip for, say, from another neighborhood.
author: Karsten P.

description:
This place is great if you know where you're going and open to what ever goes. It's like a neighborhood bar, but everyone is welcome and it's all good. 

The drinks are strong, the people are friendly and they bartenders totally respond to you without making you wait. I can't comment on the food, didn't even know they served food actually. I'd only go for drinks anyway since these days watching my budget is wise. 

No need for a collared shirt or fancy pants attire here.
author: A F.

description: I enjoy the atmosphere here, people (both the customers and staff) are friendly.  For me, Fishbowl is a great bar to hang out with friends and spend a relaxed evening.
author: Abigail R.

description: I liked the fact that it was a monday night and there were people there.  TONS of beer selections and drink specials.  A jukebox and some great classic tunes.
author: Jared F.

description: Ill definitely be back.  Good first stop for the night, just a small unassuming dive that has good drink specials.  Young crowd.
author: Wesley W.

description: The night before my birthday I was sort of coerced into coming here.  It's a small space, nothing remarkable. Halfway through my drink (a fishbowl- when in Rome...) I was neither offended nor impressed.  This is the sort of place you will enjoy if you're there with friends, but isn't entertaining enough to wash away the sour taste of a bad day.  They do however have a short menu of fried things to purchase on the cheap, and goldfish always make me smile inside.
author: Amanda B.

description: Nice low key neighborhood bar.  Cold beer and free goldfish crackers on the bar too.  Watch out on Tuesdays-Thursdays in the summer when kickball teams swarm the place.  Gets kinda crowded late night too on weekends since it's the last-stop when you're on the long train to drunk-town.
author: Rob K.

description: Really loud bar that doesn't stand out -- except for the water ski on the wall.  Not a horrible place to grab one beer, but definitely not a place to spend a night.
author: Tim G.

description: I would love to write a great review for this place but alas I don't remember leaving said bar. I do remember that they had some fish crackers on the bar. i should have had some dinner.
author: Stephen K.

description: Decent place.  Crowd was late-20's to early-30's usual Marina / Pac Heights group.  Despite this, the place had a pretty fratty feel; beer was the drink of choice down the bar, and the music reminded me of a playlist you would normally catch at a college mixer.  Would probably return, although not on the top of my list.
author: Matt O.

description: Ich war leider nur 2 Bierlaengen da. Es gibt nicht so viel zu sagen. Schmaler Pub mit Bierhockersitzgruppen. Zum Vorgluehen geeignet. Musik unauffaellig.
author: Johannes B.

description: I like this place a little more every time I go. I tend to do Happy Hour here...in fact I think I may go today. I do avoid the night time crowds, but you can get ridiculously cheap drinks here after work.
author: Adrienne G.

description: Amazing! My fiancee and I met there. Two nights before our wedding we brought 30 friends back to where it all began and the bartender was nice enough to have the very table we met at reserved for us along with flowers and a card saying "Where it all began". My fiancee literally started crying. It was amazing, and we had the perfect ending to an already amazing night. Thank you Fish Bowl and your amazing staff!
author: Eric E.

description: I tend to go to the Fishbowl on weeknights and stay away on the weekends.  I give this place major kudos for their generous drinks and friendly staff.
author: Entertainment M.

description: There are bowls of fish crackers and bowls of booze. What more could anyone ever want? This is a dive bar at its finest because i want to just dive  in. all the people who work there are fun and friendly. The locals are not sleezy because i am one of them. Some peoples comments confuse me because most of the time the bartenders themselves are singing and having fun. cheap drinks, good jukebox and places to sit. FISH Bowl rocks!
author: melissa c.

description: This place was great when Rich was here.  Ahhhhhh and when I was there.  My old neighborhood pub.  Those were the days, thank you Zach for my first 8 days in a row.
author: Melo M.

description: Nice local spot. Cheap drinks, cool bartenders, and not overly crowded. This spot either gets hit up before or after a night out. I would have given it 5 stars, but I've yet to discover these mysterious tater tots.
author: Tom F.

description: My new favorite bar in the city.  It's the grunge/dive bar in a little area I like to call the "Pac. Heights Trough." The bartenders are real and have a good sense of humor and if you get sick of the cal alumni/marina crowd at the lions den up the street this is a great place to show up.  I think they have a decent food menu too, but by the time I get there the kitchen is always closed.... This is the only bar in the city I know of that will also sell you half a bottle of J.D. for cheap - ok not really, but they pour that much into their fish bowls, which are definetly worth it.
author: Ehren D.

description: as my roommate says it "fishbowl is like cheers, where everybody knows your name". this is a neighborhood low key bar that has good drinks, super awesome bartenders who remember you and greet you with a smile, and a happy easy go lucky vibe. its a nice change of pace to have a bar around the corner open to hoodies and sandals amongst the trendy sf spots. if you are looking for a place to catch a game this is a great spot cause they have tvs in every direction. i have even fallen victim to the buck hunter game inspired by their east coasters... dang cows always get in my shot ;) warning, its tends to be a guys bar probably cause of the sports and dive feel.. no complaints at all but its always good to know.
author: Barbara C.

description: i know this bar is in "pac whites", but i have to give this bar 5 stars due to the six seconds shots the bartender poured me twice.  don't know if it was my good looks or charm, but six seconds is more than a regular ordered liquor drink or cocktail.
author: Pickle R.

description: If I could give this place 0 stars, I'd be happier.  The female bartenders are hideous beasts with the biggest chips on their shoulders.  The manager is just as bad.  My advice.....STAY AWAY-DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME!!  There's plenty of other bars with decent and good looking bartenders.
author: Jenn P.

description: i am drunk right now because of this bar. me and my girls headed over there tonight,the rad bartendress? bought us all a round of shots, good jukebox. rad rad raaad.
author: Lauren V.

description: i met a friend here for drinks last weekend and this is your typical small size diveyish bar.  its a kool local neighborhood spot if you're in the neighborhood, however, on my own, i probably wouldn't come here again, as its just not my cup of tea.  okay place to chill and relax if you're around the corner from this place as its patrons are friendly and unpretentious.  only drawback, as mentioned before, is the single bathroom, but then again for a local neighborhood joint, what more can you ask for?
author: Syonora A.

description: the drinks were good, bartenders were great and super attentive despite the fact that this place was completely packed. not really dying to go back but i wouldn't be opposed to it. it was just way too small and crowded, and the bathroom was gross.
author: Meghan H.

description: I can imagine this is a hit or miss spot, but the night I was there it was a hit, and I pledge to review accordingly! I walked in not knowing what to expect, but knowing full well that I was going on a bender. I was in the mood. The uber-stiff gin and tonics did my soul good, as did the Journey tunes. Oh wait, I think that actually damaged my soul. While I'm on the topic of music, I might as well discuss my one complaint with this oh-so-divey dive bar. I put some money in the juke box, and my songs never came on. When I asked about it, i was told that the bartenders have ultimate authority over what music is played. Cool, 'cept I just wasted my dollar. I know, it's only a dollar, but turn of the juke if you're not going to let people choose. Anyway, I'm pretty sure this is a not-quite-Pac-Heights pickup spot, so if you're looking for love in all the wrong places maybe you should try The Fishbowl. A little shoutout to the bartender, Tony, who took great care of us that night. I was lucky enough to secure a bar stool and had very attentive service. Thumbs up (that's a good way to give a dive bar kudos, right?).
author: Lisa F.

description: Always a really happy vibe and yummy cheese goldfish at the bar.
author: nikki s.

description: Everything about this place is great but the bartenders can't make a drink to save their lives. I'm not a picky drinker but come on. Any bartender should know how to make a long island.
author: David S.

description: I am writing this review to beg people to not support this bar anymore.  You'd think it is a great place bc it is a chill neighborhood bar, but then you meet Tony - the man who runs both this bar and Frankies burger joint.  He comes off as all smooth and nice, but really he is a THEIF.  My friend and I guest bartended to raise money for breast cancer.  It was a Wednesday night and we packed the bar with our friends and coworkers.  All in all, we made well over $1,000 in tips as everyone was SO generous - individual people handing us $100+ at a time because they wanted to support a good cause.  Despite staying to help clean up until after 3 am on a work night, Tony wouldn't give us our tip money.  He made us show up the following day and gave us some big speech about how "none of it goes to him and it all goes to us" and then tried to hand us $200!  I looked at him and was like you are kidding me right??  The previous night, we counted the money and also know how much our friends gave us.  He pulled us outside towards an alley and was like wait here - we will figure this out...he ran away and then came back and sneaked us another $200 as if he was doing a drug trade or something.  I told him he shouldn't be acting so shady because we didn't do anything wrong, in fact, we were raising money to help cancer patients!  In the end, we got a bit more money, but not close to what we actually earned.  After telling other people about our experience, I have heard several stories about how he has stolen from other guest bartenders as well.  I truly hope that people will read this and not support a place that steals from its patrons....
author: Colleen S.
